0.title: Tried to do matchmaking at party, asked Shanaya to speak to Tiger: Johar
0.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said he tried to engage in "matchmaking" during one of his parties by asking actor Sanjay Kapoor's daughter Shanaya Kapoor to speak to actor Tiger Shroff. "After ten minutes, Shanaya came...and said, 'I think he's really bored of me'," added Johar. Tiger responded by stating that he's feeling very ''bad", adding he thought he was being cool.

1.title: At this stage of my life, I don't have to work for stardom or money: Nagarjuna
1.article_body: Actor Nagarjuna has said that he wants to keep working till he can. "At this stage of my life, I don't have to work for stardom or money...except job satisfaction," he stated. Nagarjuna added, "My father literally died with his boots on. He collapsed on the set of a film. For an actor what can be better than that?"

2.title: Hong Kong not the right opposition to judge Virat Kohli: Gambhir
2.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has said Hong Kong are not the right opposition to judge whether Virat Kohli is back in "rhythm". He added, "I hope Kohli will be seen in better rhythm in upcoming matches because it was not that sort of quality bowling." Kohli scored unbeaten 59 runs off 44 balls in the match.

3.title: Baby born with horn-like structure instead of legs in MP, pic surfaces
3.article_body: A baby was born without any legs in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpur district on August 26. Instead, the baby had a horn-like structure that protruded from below his torso. The baby was reportedly underdeveloped and weighed only 1 kg and 400 grams. The newborn has been admitted to the Shivpuri District Hospital where he is currently kept under supervision.

4.title: Simply can't fathom this approach: Venkatesh Prasad on KL Rahul's 36(39) vs Hong Kong
4.article_body: Reacting to KL Rahul's 39-ball 36-run knock against Hong Kong, former India fast bowler Venkatesh Prasad tweeted, "Is there something in the pitch that is not visible?" He added, "Simply can't fathom this approach especially from KL Rahul." India scored 70 runs in their first 10 overs against Hong Kong, but went on to put up a total of 192/2.

5.title: I wouldn't date Kartik Aaryan as I know him 'too well': Kriti Sanon
5.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon said one of the reasons why she wouldn't date actor Kartik Aaryan is because she knows him "too well". Kriti added that a reason why she'd date Kartik is because she knows him well. Talking about actor Tiger Shroff, Kriti stated that one of the reasons she wouldn't date the actor is because he "flips too much".

6.title: 2023 Bengal panchayat polls will be 'grand affair': TMC's Anubrata Mondal
6.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Anubrata Mondal, who was arrested by CBI in connection with an alleged cattle smuggling case, said the panchayat election next year will be a "grand affair". "TMC supporters should work hard to ensure the party's victory," Mondal told reporters while being brought to Kolkata from Asansol. He was sent to 14-day judicial custody last week.

7.title: MBBS student found dead in her room at Delhi’s Safdarjung Hospital
7.article_body: A 22-year-old final year MBBS student was found dead in her room at New Delhi's Safdarjung Hospital on Thursday morning. Police recovered a note in her diary that stated she was under depression. They also found two empty packets of anti-depressants in her room. "Statements of...[her] friends...were recorded, and no foul play has been found so far," police said.

8.title: Apple CEO Tim Cook pledges support to Pak amid floods; Malala thanks him
8.article_body: Apple CEO Tim Cook has announced support for Pakistan amid the devastating floods. "Apple will donate to relief and recovery efforts on the ground," he said. Activist Malala Yousafzai thanked the Apple CEO for "providing support to Pakistan in this very difficult time". One-third of Pakistan has been completely submerged by historic flooding, which has killed at least 1,191 people.

9.title: KCR didn't even accept Nitish as a PM candidate: Sushil Modi
9.article_body: BJP leader Sushil Kumar Modi said that Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao didn't even accept Nitish Kumar as a Prime Minister candidate. His reaction came after a press conference video went viral in which Rao was questioned by a journalist whether he will back Nitish Kumar as the PM candidate. To this Rao responded, "Who am I to decide."

10.title: Moody's cuts India's growth forecast to 7.7% from 8.8% for 2022
10.article_body: Global credit rating agency Moody's Investors Service cut India's economic growth projection to 7.7% for 2022 from its May projection of 8.8%. It said that the economic momentum will slow down on a sequential basis owing to rising interest rates, uneven monsoon and slowing global growth. However, the rating agency said the services and manufacturing sectors have seen robust upswings.

11.title: Delhi Assembly passes motion of confidence tabled by CM Arvind Kejriwal
11.article_body: Delhi Assembly on Thursday passed the motion of confidence moved by CM Arvind Kejriwal through a voice vote as well as division of votes. Fifty-eight MLAs voted in favour and none voted against it as BJP MLAs were not present in Assembly. The motion was brought amid allegations by the AAP that the BJP was trying to topple its government.

12.title: Meta plans to create more paid features for Instagram, Facebook
12.article_body: Meta is setting up a new group to create more paid products and features for Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp. "Any new product will be complementary to our existing ads business," a Meta spokesperson told Reuters on Wednesday. The group, named New Monetization Experiences, will be reportedly led by the company's former head of research Pratiti Raychoudhury.

13.title: PM Modi is strong personality yet sensitive at heart: Film producer Jain
13.article_body: Film producer Mahaveer Jain said that he was "very fortunate" to meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Speaking about PM Modi, Mahaveer said, "He is a very strong personality yet very sensitive and emotional at heart." Jain further added, "He himself is a very creative person who admires the creative fraternity for its positive contribution."

14.title: April-July fiscal deficit at ₹3.40 lakh crore, 20.5% of FY23 target
14.article_body: The Centre's fiscal deficit was 20.5% of the annual target in July end as against 21.3% in the year-ago period, the Controller General of Accounts data showed. The fiscal deficit was ₹3.40 lakh crore during the April-July period in actual terms. For the full FY23, the fiscal deficit is pegged at ₹16.6 lakh crore or 6.4% of the GDP.

15.title: Expecting too much too soon will create problems: Karim on Rahul, Virat's batting
15.article_body: Referring to KL Rahul and Virat Kohli's innings against Hong Kong, former India cricketer Saba Karim has said India could've scored 15-20 more runs in the match but the team needs to "nurture" the experienced players once they come back after a break. "If you expect too much too soon, it will create problems for your own team," added Karim

16.title: Taiwan looks forward to producing 'democracy chips' with US: Prez
16.article_body: Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen told the governor of the US state of Arizona, Doug Ducey, that the island nation is looking forward to producing "democracy chips" with the US. Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd (TSMC) is constructing a $12 billion plant in Arizona. Ducey told Tsai that partnership with Taiwan was "the greatest" in the semiconductor industry.

17.title: RSS wasn't that bad before, many people in RSS don't support BJP: Mamata
17.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday said that RSS wasn't that bad earlier. "I don't think they (RSS) are that bad. Still, there are many good people in RSS and they don't support BJP. They will also break their silence one day," she added. Removing BJP from Centre would be my last fight, Mamata had said on Monday.

18.title: IMF provisionally agrees to give crisis-hit Sri Lanka $2.9-bn loan
18.article_body: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Thursday said that it has provisionally agreed to give a loan of about $2.9 billion to Sri Lanka which is grappling with an economic crisis. IMF and Sri Lanka have entered a 48-month-long arrangement under the former's Extended Fund Facility. The agreement is subject to approval by the IMF management and its Executive Board.

19.title: AAP has just been born but 169 cases against 49 MLAs so far: Kejriwal
19.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said that the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has "just been born" but there have been 169 cases against 49 party MLAs so far. "Of these, 134 (cases) have been closed," he added in the Delhi Assembly. The investigation agencies have not been able to prove any of the BJP's corruption allegations, Kejriwal further said.

20.title: Aamir Khan Productions posts apology video, says 'Hum sab insane hai'; later deletes it
20.article_body: An apology video, now deleted, was posted on the social media pages of Aamir Khan Productions on Thursday during the Jain festival of Samvatsari. Starting with 'Micchami Dukkadam', it carried typos with a Hindi voiceover and said, "Hum sab insane hai…Aur galtiyan humse...hoti hai." It further said that if I've ever hurt your feelings, then I ask for forgiveness.

21.title: Chinese city of Shenzhen expands COVID rules as cases rise
21.article_body: The Chinese city of Shenzhen tightened COVID restrictions on Thursday as cases continued to rise. Authorities have suspended large events and indoor entertainment for three days in Bao'an, the city's most populous district. Officials have urged residents not to leave the city unless urgent and those who must leave have to show proof of two negative tests within 48 hours.

22.title: After dispute, man texts colleagues saying he's ending his life; found dead in Gurugram
22.article_body: An employee at a multinational firm in Gurugram has allegedly died by suicide as he was upset with some of his colleagues, police said on Wednesday. His wife said she got a call from his company, informing her that a dispute took place in office and her husband has sent a message saying he was going to end his life.

23.title: 90-yr-old man gets 3-yr jail for sexually assaulting minor girl in Kerala
23.article_body: A Kerala court sentenced a 90-year-old man to three years in jail for sexually assaulting a minor girl in the Palakkad district of the state. The case pertained to 2020 when the accused assaulted the 15-year-old girl, who was his neighbour. According to the Special Public Prosecutor, the court found the accused guilty after examining nine witnesses and several documents.

24.title: IMF to provide Sri Lanka with $2.9 billion amid economic crisis
24.article_body: The International Monetary Fund will provide $2.9 billion to Sri Lanka over a period of four years under a preliminary agreement. In a statement, IMF team visiting Sri Lanka said that the arrangement will work to restore financial, macroeconomic stability, debt sustainability and unlock the country's growth potential. Sri Lanka is facing shortage of essential goods like fuel and medicines.

25.title: Differently-abled child found dead in Delhi, juvenile domestic help held
25.article_body: A juvenile domestic help was apprehended for allegedly murdering a differently-abled child in southwest Delhi, police said. The help was hired to take care of the child, police added. The accused also allegedly stole jewellery, a mobile phone and ₹40,000. The deceased's parents had gone to a temple and his sister had gone to a market during the incident.

26.title: Neither KCR nor Nitish Kumar will be CM by 2024: Sushil Modi
26.article_body: Former Bihar Deputy CM Sushil Modi said neither CM Nitish Kumar nor his Telangana counterpart K Chandrashekar Rao will be CM of their respective states by 2024. "Those whose own seats aren't safe are dreaming about becoming PM," Sushil Modi added. "KCR should better save his own CM seat in Telangana in 2023 polls," he stated.

27.title: Unemployment rate fell to 7.6% during Apr-June in urban areas: NSO
27.article_body: The unemployment rate for people in the age group of 15 years and above in urban areas dropped to 7.6% during April-June 2022 from 12.6% in the corresponding period last year, the National Statistical Office (NSO) said. This was led by an improved labour force participation ratio, pointing towards a sustained economic recovery after the COVID-19 pandemic.

28.title: SpiceJet CFO resigns after airline's Q1 net loss widens to ₹789 cr
28.article_body: SpiceJet's Chief Financial Officer (CFO) Sanjeev Taneja resigned from his post amid the airline reporting a widening of net loss to ₹789 crore during the April-June quarter, on Wednesday. The loss in the corresponding period last fiscal was ₹729 crore. SpiceJet said that its Board has identified a candidate for Taneja's replacement and the vacancy would be filled in September.

29.title: PMPML to run over 800 additional buses for Ganpati festival
29.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) will run extra buses for residents in Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad areas during the Ganesh festival. While 168 additional buses will ply on September 1, 2 and 8, for September 3, 7 and 9, 654 more buses will be seen on roads. The public transport utility will also provide special night bus service.

30.title: World no. 1 Medvedev moves into US Open 3rd round with straight-sets win
30.article_body: Defending champion and world number one Daniil Medvedev entered the third round of the ongoing US Open 2022 after defeating Frenchman Arthur Rinderknech in straight sets. Medvedev won with a scoreline of 6-2, 7-5, 6-3 in two hours and 11 minutes. "In general, I'm happy with my level in the third set, so that's great," said Medvedev after the match.

31.title: Google workers protest outside US offices against $1.2 bn Israeli deal
31.article_body: Former and current Google employees protested outside its offices in San Francisco and called for it to end Project Nimbus, a $1.2 billion contract with Israel which includes Amazon as well. An employee said workers went public after their concerns were met with silence internally. Additional demonstrations are planned on September 8 in New York, Bay Area and Seattle.

32.title: Nitish Kumar stands up to leave presser on PM candidate's question, KCR holds him
32.article_body: A clip of a press conference of Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao has gone viral. Kumar is seen getting up to leave when Rao is asked if he will back Kumar as the PM candidate and his views on Rahul Gandhi's candidature as PM. Rao is then seen holding Kumar and requesting him to sit.

33.title: Tiger says Rekha played Big B's mother & love interest in films, Karan reacts
33.article_body: During the quiz round in the 'Koffee With Karan 7' episode featuring Kriti Sanon and Tiger Shroff, Karan Johar asked them to name the actress who played both Amitabh Bachchan's mother and love interest in films. Tiger replied, "Rekha ma'am?" Reacting to this, Karan said, "What? She never...played his mother." Karan revealed the actresses were Waheeda Rehman and Rakhee.

34.title: AAP calls Pune's VIP toilet plan unnecessary; PMC says much needed
34.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) criticised Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) plan to build 15 VIP public toilets across the city at a cost of over ₹36 lakh. "Small toilets should be constructed instead of costly and more seat blocks...The existing toilet system should be improved," AAP said. However, PMC said that the city badly required clean and well-managed toilets.

35.title: Man kills 35-year-old inmate at Pune rehab centre over toilet issue
35.article_body: A 35-year-old man was allegedly killed by a fellow inmate at a rehab centre in Pune's Dhayari, police said. The accused quarrelled with the victim over a toilet issue on Wednesday morning, police added. They had arguments while standing in a queue and the accused killed the victim by tying a towel around his neck inside the toilet, police stated.

36.title: Automobile offender arrested in Hyd, vehicles worth ₹12 lakh seized
36.article_body: Hyderabad's Medipally Police on Tuesday arrested an automobile offender and seized one car, six two-wheelers and gold and silver ornaments, all worth over ₹12 lakh from him. The accused, identified as Bharath Kumar Reddy, is a resident of Manikonda, police said. Notably, police verified over 180 CCTV cameras to track the stolen four-wheeler leading to Reddy's arrest, Rachakonda Police said.

37.title: 3 illegal colonies demolished in Gurugram: Officials
37.article_body: Gurugram authorities carried out a drive on Wednesday and demolished three illegal colonies in Farrukhnagar, Mubarikpur and Taj Nagar, officials said. The team used a JCB machine to demolish the illegal constructions and boundary walls of four plots among other structures, they added. The drive against illegal construction will continue, District Town Planner (Enforcement) Amit Madholia said.

38.title: Liquor should be diluted, consumed at specific time, says Chhattisgarh minister
38.article_body: Chhattisgarh minister Premsai Singh Tekam, while speaking at a de-addiction drive event, said alcohol should be diluted and consumed at a specific time. "There should be self-control. I once went to a meeting where they spoke for and against liquor. One side spoke of its benefits. Liquor should be diluted, there should be a duration (to consume it)," Tekam added.

39.title: SpiceJet shares fall nearly 15% after CFO resigns amid widening losses
39.article_body: SpiceJet shares declined nearly 15% during Thursday’s intraday trade to a one-month low after the airline reported widening of net loss to ₹789 crore in the June quarter. Notably, its CFO Sanjeev Taneja also resigned amid losses and a series of mid-air incidents. SpiceJet stock, which has fallen over 36% so far this year, was currently trading at ₹44.15.

40.title: I was depressed & heartbroken: Tiger Shroff on recent 'setback' in films
40.article_body: Talking about his reaction after his recent film didn't perform well, during his appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', actor Tiger Shroff said, "I was heartbroken. I was depressed." "I'm just a very extreme person, I wouldn't say I sacrificed a lot because I like what I do," he further added. The actor's recent film 'Heropanti 2' failed to perform.

41.title: This is what I do best: Serena Williams after defeating world no. 2 in US Open
41.article_body: During her on-court interview after defeating world number two Anett Kontaveit in her US Open second-round match, Serena Williams said, "This is what I do best." She added, "I'm just Serena...I'm super competitive...I'm just looking at it as a bonus." The twenty three-time singles' Grand Slam champion had earlier stated she'll be "evolving away" from tennis following the US Open.

42.title: Days after girl set on fire by stalker dies, half-burnt body of woman found in Dumka
42.article_body: A woman's half-burnt body was found near Pahadpur village in the Taljhari Police Station area in Jharkhand's Dumka on Wednesday, police said. The victim's identity could not be established as the body was burnt beyond recognition, an official said. This comes days after a Class 12 girl died after she was set on fire by her alleged stalker in Dumka.

43.title: 18 years ago you chose to give up your high heels for me: Rishi Sunak to wife Akshata
43.article_body: UK PM candidate Rishi Sunak told wife Akshata Murthy at a campaigning event, "I'm incredibly grateful that 18 years ago you chose to give up your high heels and take a chance on the short kid with a backpack." Conservative Party members will pick the UK's next Prime Minister. The winner is set to be announced on Monday.

44.title: I was hanging by a thread: Kyrgios on his 2nd round win vs Bonzi in US Open
44.article_body: Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios has entered the third round of the ongoing US Open 2022 after defeating Frenchman Benjamin Bonzi 7-6(7-3), 6-4, 4-6, 6-4. "I was hanging by a thread. His level today was incredible...I played some really risky tennis late in the fourth, which paid off," said Kyrgios. He'll now face American JJ Wolf in the third round.

45.title: Price of commercial LPG cylinders cut by up to ₹100; list of rates in cities released
45.article_body: State-owned fuel retailers on Thursday announced a reduction in the prices of commercial LPG cylinders. From today, a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder will be cheaper by ₹91.50 in Delhi and will be available for ₹1,885 instead of the earlier ₹1,976.50. Apart from Delhi, the prices have been reduced by up to ₹100 in Kolkata, Chennai and Mumbai.

46.title: Wanted my debut to be role which makes difference: Sargun on 'Cuttputlli'
46.article_body: Actress Sargun Mehta, who will be making her Bollywood debut with 'Cuttputlli', said, "I always wanted my debut to be a role which makes a difference to the story irrespective of the length." She added the subject of the film was "very interesting". Sargun stated, "I was getting an opportunity to work with Akshay Kumar, who is a brilliant actor."

47.title: West Bengal raises upper age limit for police recruitment to 30 years
47.article_body: West Bengal government on Wednesday decided to raise the upper age limit for recruitment of police constables from 27 years to 30 years, CM Mamata Banerjee said. Further, civic volunteers, village police, home guards and civil defence personnel will be eligible for promotion and relaxation will be given in upper age limit up to 35 years, Banerjee added.

48.title: PMC to build 15 VIP public toilets in Pune at the cost of ₹36 lakh
48.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has prepared a preliminary estimate of over ₹36 lakh to build 15 VIP public toilets across the city. Of the total cost, state government will share ₹25 lakh while PMC will have to spend ₹11 lakh. These toilets will have vending machines, paper napkins, sanitary napkins, and disposal machines along with shower and toilet facilities.

49.title: UP govt to conduct survey of unrecognised madrassas across state
49.article_body: UP government has announced to conduct a survey of unrecognised madrassas in the state to gather information about curriculum, the number of teachers and basic facilities available there, among others. Minister of State for Minority Welfare Danish Azad Ansari said details such as number of students studying there, facilities of drinking water, electricity supply and toilet will be collected.

50.title: Nitish calls for meeting after lathi-charge on protesting BPSC candidates
50.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has taken cognisance of the problem of the candidates regarding the examination of the Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC), the CM's office said. He has called for a meeting with the Chief Secretary and other office bearers for its solution, it added. This comes following protests by candidates who were lathi-charged by the police in Patna.

51.title: Tesla tests SUVs under 50°C temperature in Dubai, shares pics
51.article_body: Tesla took to Instagram and Twitter to share pictures of its field quality engineers testing SUVs in Dubai. The company said the "extreme heat and durability testing" was conducted during hottest time of the year in Dubai when temperatures reach over 50°C. According to the pictures, Model X Plaid and Model Y were among the vehicles included in the test.

52.title: SpaceX launching Starlink satellites roughly every 5 days: Musk
52.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to note that the firm is launching Starlink satellites roughly every five days. This comes after SpaceX launched 46 Starlink satellites on Tuesday, completing its sixth launch this month. SpaceX has launched 39 missions this year and Musk has confirmed that it plans to launch 100 orbital missions in 2023.

53.title: Serena beats world no.2 Anett Kontaveit, enters 3rd round of US Open
53.article_body: Discussing her 7-6(4), 2-6, 6-2 win against second seed Anett Kontaveit to enter US Open's third round, Serena Williams said, "After losing the second set, I thought 'Oh, my goodness'." "I had to give my best...because 'this could be it'," Serena added. "I don't have anything to lose. I've had an X on my back since 1999," she stated.

54.title: Shame that considered such a frivolous man a leader: Khera to Azad
54.article_body: Congress leader Pawan Khera criticised former Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad over a television interview following his exit from the party where he mocked Rahul Gandhi's foreign trips. Sharing the video of Ghulam Nabi Azad's comment, Pawan Khera wrote on Twitter, "It is a matter of shame that such a frivolous man was considered a leader."

55.title: Oil tanker briefly blocks Suez Canal; freed after 5 hours
55.article_body: A 64,000-tonne oil tanker briefly blocked the traffic in Suez Canal after it ran aground on Wednesday. While it took around five hours to free Affinity V, a technical failure in the vessel's steering mechanism caused it to hit the bank of the canal. Earlier in March 2021, Japanese-owned Ever Given blocked the canal for six days before being released.

56.title: Centre hikes windfall profit tax on export of diesel, ATF
56.article_body: The government has increased the windfall profit tax on the export of diesel to ₹13.5 per litre from ₹7, while that on aviation turbine fuel exports to ₹9 per litre from ₹2. The tax on domestically-produced crude oil has also been hiked by ₹300 per tonne to ₹13,300. The prices come into effect from Thursday, a Finance Ministry notification said.

57.title: Flush from $250M Series-D, Rippling invests in B'luru talent: Rippling
57.article_body: On the heels of its $250M Series-D fundraising round, Rippling is doubling down on Bengaluru as an engineering hub, the company said, with a recruiting campaign aimed at attracting top engineering talent. It added that the campaign focuses on the level of ownership that engineers experience at Rippling compared to other top tech firms with a substantial presence in Bengaluru.

58.title: Are you saying Rahul should be dropped: Suryakumar to journalist asking if he'd open
58.article_body: After a journalist asked Suryakumar Yadav if he'd open with Rohit Sharma at some point in Asia Cup, Suryakumar Yadav jokingly replied, "Are you saying...KL Rahul should be dropped?" He added, "I'm really flexible to bat at any number. I've told coach and captain that they can play me at any number but I want to be in the team."

59.title: Many more wickets will fall now: Sushil Modi after Kartikeya Singh's resignation
59.article_body: After Bihar Minister Kartikeya Singh, who is accused in the kidnapping of a builder in 2014, resigned from his post amid protests, ex-Deputy CM Sushil Modi tweeted, "The first wicket has just fallen. Many more wickets will fall now." Furthermore, Sushil Modi said, "Nitish Kumar got clean bowled in the first over itself."

60.title: Nashik-bound SpiceJet flight returns to Delhi due to 'autopilot' snag
60.article_body: A Nashik-bound SpiceJet flight returned to Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport on Thursday morning due to an 'autopilot' snag the plane encountered midway, an official said. SpiceJet flight SG8363 took off from Delhi at 6:54am and returned after an hour of its departure time. The Boeing 737 aircraft landed safely and the passengers were shifted to a smaller Q400 aircraft.

61.title: Police add POCSO charges in Dumka girl's murder case after deceased found to be a minor
61.article_body: Police added sections of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012 (POCSO) in the Dumka girl's murder case in Jharkhand. This comes after the state Child Welfare Committee said the girl was a minor as per the Class 10 board examination mark sheet. The Class 12 girl died after she was set ablaze by a man named Shahrukh.

62.title: Ex-Punjab minister Bharat Bhushan Ashu sent to 14-day judicial custody
62.article_body: Former Punjab Food and Civil Supplies Minister Bharat Bhushan Ashu has been sent to judicial custody for 14 days in connection with the alleged food grains transportation tenders scam. Earlier, Ashu was sent to police custody till August 27 following his arrest from Ludhiana by Punjab Vigilance Bureau on August 22. The defence counsel called the case "false and frivolous".

63.title: Meta takes action against 2.7 cr Facebook, Instagram posts in India
63.article_body: Social media giant Meta had taken action against 2.5 crore posts on Facebook and 20 lakh posts on Instagram in July in India under the Information Technology Rules, 2021, it said. Action was taken against 1.73 crore spam content, 27 lakh posts related to "adult nudity and sexual activity" and 23 lakh "violent and graphic content" related content on Facebook.

64.title: 5 minor girls go missing from shelter home in Pune, search underway
64.article_body: Police have launched a search for five minor girls who went missing from Matoshree Ravma shelter home in Pune's Hadapsar. The incident came to light on Tuesday morning, reports said. According to police, the girls hail from Bihar, Chhattisgarh, Jalgaon, Buldhana and Thane. The shelter had identified their parents and was making arrangements to hand over the minors, police added.

65.title: Eligible police personnel to get houses at ₹15 lakh in redeveloped BDD chawls
65.article_body: The Maharashtra Housing Department issued a notification to give houses at ₹15 lakh in redeveloped Bombay Development Directorate (BDD) chawls to police personnel who were residing in BDD chawls till January 1, 2011. Earlier, the price for these houses was fixed at ₹50 lakh. The notification comes just five days after CM Eknath Shinde announced the same in the Assembly.

66.title: 'The Kapil...' is my show as well, I'll be back again: Krushna Abhishek
66.article_body: Actor-comedian Krushna Abhishek has said that 'The Kapil Sharma Show' is his show as well and revealed that he will be back again. Speaking about the rumours about the tension between him and Kapil Sharma, Krushna said, "There is no issue." This comes as Krushna had previously said he will not be featuring in the show due to "agreement issues".

67.title: Apple releases iOS 12.5.6 update for older iPhones with security fixes
67.article_body: Apple has released an iOS 12.5.6 update for older iPhone, iPod touch and iPad models that are not able to run iOS 13 or newer updates. The update fixes the WebKit vulnerability, which was already fixed in iOS 15.6.1 and iPadOS 15.6.1. It is available for iPhone 5s, iPhone 6, iPhone 6 Plus and iPad Air, among others.

68.title: India reports 7,946 new COVID-19 cases and 37 deaths
68.article_body: India has reported 7,946 new COVID-19 cases and 25 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Health Ministry. Additionally, 12 reconciled deaths from earlier period were added in Kerala. This comes a day after the country recorded 7,231 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in the country dropped to 62,748, while the daily positivity rate stood at 2.98%.

69.title: I wouldn't have agreed to have Pant instead of Hardik in the XI: Gambhir
69.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has said he wouldn't have agreed to have Rishabh Pant instead of Hardik Pandya in the playing XI against Hong Kong. "If you're resting Hardik, then I think Deepak Hooda, who can bowl a couple of overs, deserves a go," he added. Gambhir, however, also stated that Rishabh should've played, but in place of Dinesh Karthik.

70.title: Yen drops to 24-year low to 139.59/dollar as Treasury yields rise
70.article_body: The yen fell to its lowest to 139.59 per dollar in Thursday’s trading recording a 24-year low as US Treasury yields surged through 3.2% owing to the Federal Reserve’s hawkish stance at the Jackson Hole symposium. During the 1998 Asian financial crisis, the yen had reached around 146 to the dollar. Japan had previously intervened at levels around 130.

71.title: SpiceJet makes payments in 'graded format', delays salaries for 2nd straight month
71.article_body: SpiceJet employees have alleged a delay in their salaries for the second consecutive month. Meanwhile, the airline said that the salaries will be credited in a "graded format". In an internal communication, mentioning the delay, SpiceJet said the "previous few months have been difficult" due to a "superlative fuel price hike" and also a "historically lean period of July-September".

72.title: I dream of buying a private jet, don't have to prove I'm relatable: Kartik
72.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has revealed that his dreams are getting bigger and said that his wishes of buying a Lamborghini and becoming an actor were fulfilled. Kartik was asked if he now dreams of buying a private jet. To this, he replied, "Private jet should also come...I don't have to prove that I come from Gwalior and that I'm relatable."

73.title: Before going to bat, I told Rohit that I'd try to take the tempo up: Suryakumar
73.article_body: Talking about his unbeaten 68*(26) against Hong Kong in Asia Cup, Suryakumar Yadav said, "Before I got out to bat, I spoke to Rohit...and told [him] I'd try to take the tempo up." Suryakumar came in to bat when India were 94/2 after 12.6 overs and added 98 runs with Virat Kohli. The 31-year-old smashed four sixes in final over.

74.title: Sensex falls 700 points, Nifty at 17,558 in opening trade
74.article_body: Benchmark indices opened in the red on Thursday with Sensex falling 707.39 points at 58,829.68 and Nifty down 200.80 points at 17,558.50. Infosys, SBI Life Insurance, TCS, Hindalco Industries, ONGC were among the major Nifty losers, while the shares of Bharti Airtel, Bajaj Auto, IndusInd Bank, Bajaj Finserv and UltraTech Cement gained. Nearly 1,101 shares advanced and 1,052 shares declined.

75.title: Noida Police sends ₹64 lakh bill to firm which carried twin towers' demolition
75.article_body: Noida Police has raised a bill of ₹64 lakh to Edifice Engineering, the firm that carried out Noida's Supertech twin towers demolition, for providing personnel as security escort when explosives were transported to the demolition site. During the process of preparation for demolition of the towers, explosives were transported daily from Haryana's Palwal, the police said.

76.title: Jacqueline deleted data on Sukesh from her phones to hamper investigation: ED
76.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate in its chargesheet has said that actress Jacqueline Fernandez "knowingly and deliberately deleted all the data" with respect to conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar from her phones with an aim to "hamper the investigation" to save herself and her family. She allegedly also requested her staff to delete data related to Sukesh from their phones.

77.title: Partha destroyed unemployed youth's dreams, should be punished severely: BJP leader
77.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari said ex-West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee should be punished "severely". "A special trial should be conducted...under the influence of Mamata Banerjee, Chatterjee took a bribe of ₹800-1,000 crore...destroyed the dreams of unemployed youth," Adhikari added. A special court extended judicial custody of Chatterjee and his close aide Arpita Mukherjee till September 14.

78.title: Been single for 1.25 yrs: Kartik on if he lied about his relationship with Sara
78.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, during an interview, was asked if he lied about his relationship with Sara Ali Khan after Karan Johar confirmed his relationship on 'Koffee With Karan'. To this, he replied, "I've been single [for] the past 1.25 years, I don't know about anything else." Kartik and Sara were rumoured to be dating while filming 'Love Aaj Kal 2'.

79.title: Will fight SC order on Bengaluru Idgah Maidan: Karnataka Minister
79.article_body: The Idgah Maidan in Bengaluru's Chamarajpet is a "public property" and the legal fight over its ownership will continue in courts, said Karnataka Revenue Minister R Ashoka. His remarks came after the Supreme Court on Tuesday denied permission for celebrating Ganesh Chaturthi on the ground and ordered status quo. "People...were eager to celebrate Ganesh Chaturthi at the ground," he added.

80.title: Punjab bans sarpanch proxies; bars elected women's male relatives from meetings
80.article_body: Punjab government has banned proxies for women heading panchayats in the state. Husbands or relatives of elected women will not be allowed in any meeting, it added. "I have been getting reports that most of the women sarpanches don't attend meetings...What is the purpose of reservation for women if this happens?" Rural Development and Panchayats Minister Kuldeep Singh Dhaliwal said.

81.title: China's detention of Uyghurs in Xinjiang may constitute crimes against humanity: UN
81.article_body: China's "discriminatory detention" of Uyghurs and other Muslims in Xinjiang region may constitute crimes against humanity, the outgoing UN human rights chief has said in a report. The report added that "serious human rights violations have been committed" in Xinjiang "in the context of the Government's application of counter-terrorism and counter-'extremism' strategies''.

82.title: Short of words to describe Suryakumar Yadav's innings: Rohit Sharma
82.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma said "words will be short" to describe Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 68-run innings against Hong Kong in their Asia Cup match on Wednesday. "We've seen that with Suryakumar every now and then. He comes up with [such] kinds of knocks. He just comes out and bats fearlessly which is what the team expects from him," added Rohit.

83.title: BJP govt turned probe agencies into political instruments: Tejashwi
83.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said the BJP government at the Centre has turned investigative agencies into instruments for "political revenge" in the past eight years. "Our opposition to the CBI now is not against the institution but their politically motivated mode of operation...We were never against...officers of these agencies. We know that they are just following orders," Yadav added.

84.title: Mob of commuters manhandle station master in Thane after train delay
84.article_body: A mob of commuters manhandled a station master as MEMU trains were running behind schedule on Mumbai's Vasai Road-Diva railway route, the Railway Police said. The angry commuters staged a protest at Thane's Kaman Road railway station for over 90 minutes before charging at the station master. Later, the situation was brought under control by the Government Railway Police (GRP).

85.title: Traffic curbs imposed in Shastripuram for 90 days amid GHMC works
85.article_body: Certain traffic restrictions have been imposed in Hyderabad's Shastripuram area amid grade separator works taken up by the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC). The curbs will be in place for 90 days, from September 1 to November 30, according to a press release. As per reports, vehicle entry will be restricted from Vattepally-Mahmooda Hotel to Mehfil Hotel, Mailardevpally junction.

86.title: Hong Kong cricketer Kinchit proposes to his girlfriend in stadium after India match
86.article_body: Hong Kong batter Kinchit Shah proposed to his girlfriend in the stadium after his team's Asia Cup 2022 match against India in Dubai on Wednesday. A video went viral showing Kinchit going down on one knee and offering the ring to his girlfriend, who accepted his proposal. Fans and his teammates were seen cheering for him during the proposal.

87.title: Police crack ₹3.6 crore cash dacoity case in Pune, 6 arrested
87.article_body: Police arrested six persons in connection with looting cash worth ₹3.6 crore from a car on the Pune-Solapur highway. The incident took place on Friday when the accused intercepted the victim's vehicle, opened fire and escaped with a bag containing cash kept in the boot. "Three of the accused were arrested from Pune...others were arrested from Rajasthan," police said.

88.title: Australia announce their squad for T20 World Cup 2022
88.article_body: Defending champions Australia have announced their squad for T20 World Cup 2022. Batter Tim David has been included in the 15-member squad. His selection over leg-spinner Mitchell Swepson is the only change from the group that won the T20 World Cup 2021 in the UAE. Australia's T20 World Cup 2022 campaign will begin against New Zealand on October 22.

89.title: Snap CEO confirms 20% job cuts, says 'We must reduce cost to avoid ongoing losses'
89.article_body: In a letter to staff posted on Snap’s website, CEO Evan Spiegel has confirmed 20% job cuts at the company as the latest quarterly revenue growth of 8% was "well below" expectations. Spiegel wrote, "Unfortunately, given our current lower rate of revenue growth, it has become clear that we must reduce our cost structure to avoid incurring significant ongoing losses."

90.title: India's first virtual school was launched by Centre last year, not Delhi govt: NIOS
90.article_body: The Centre-run National Institute of Open Schooling (NIOS) has countered Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's claim that his government has launched the first virtual school in the country. The NIOS said the first virtual school of India was launched by it in August 2021, adding that 4.46 lakh assignments were uploaded by the NIOS learners in the recently completed academic session.

91.title: 2 held for killing 40-yr-old man, throwing body on railway track in Delhi
91.article_body: Delhi Police arrested two men for allegedly killing a 40-year-old man while trying to rob him. This comes after police received information that a body was lying on the track between Ghevra and Bahadurgarh railway stations. The accused consumed liquor with the victim following which they attacked him but found only ₹1,020 and an ATM card, police said.

92.title: How do the Asia Cup 2022 points tables read after India's victory against Hong Kong?
92.article_body: With their 40-run victory against Hong Kong in Asia Cup 2022, India confirmed a first-place finish in Group A and advanced to Super 4. Pakistan and Hong Kong, who'll face each other on Friday, are placed second and third, respectively. Meanwhile, Afghanistan are on top of Group B points table, with Bangladesh and Sri Lanka being second and third, respectively.

93.title: I was wondering why he wasn't leaving the field: Suryakumar on Virat Kohli's gesture
93.article_body: On being asked about Virat Kohli bowing down to him and asking him to walk out of the field first after his knock of 68*(26) against Hong Kong, Suryakumar Yadav said, "It was a heartwarming gesture." He added, "I've never seen something like this. I was wondering why he wasn't leaving the field. I loved batting with him."

94.title: Hong Kong gift jersey with handwritten message to Virat Kohli, he shares pic
94.article_body: Hong Kong gifted a jersey with a handwritten message on it to Virat Kohli following their Asia Cup match against India. Kohli took to his Instagram Stories to share a picture of the jersey. "Virat...Thank you for inspiring a generation. We stand with you! There are many incredible days ahead. With strength, with love, Team Hong Kong," the message read.

95.title: NASA awards 5 more astronaut missions to ISS to SpaceX worth $1.4 bn
95.article_body: NASA has awarded five additional astronaut missions to the ISS to SpaceX under a $1.4 billion contract order. This brings SpaceX's total contracted missions for its Crew Dragon astronaut capsule to 14. The award "allows NASA to maintain an uninterrupted US capability for human access to the space station until 2030, with two unique commercial crew industry partners," NASA said.

96.title: Green corridor in Delhi helps transport heart across 5.5 km in 4.25 minutes
96.article_body: A green corridor created by Delhi Traffic Police on Wednesday helped transport a heart across 5.5 km in 4.25 minutes. The corridor was created between AIIMS Delhi and Fortis Hospital to transport a 55-year-old brain-dead woman's heart for a 19-year-old boy who has been suffering for 1.5 years. Police said it was challenging task as commuters use the route extensively.

97.title: India beat Hong Kong to reach Asia Cup Super 4 as Suryakumar breaks multiple records
97.article_body: India beat Hong Kong by 40 runs to qualify for Super 4 stage of Asia Cup 2022. Suryakumar Yadav slammed 68*(26), the highest score by a batter in the ongoing tournament. He also recorded most sixes by an Indian (six) in a T20 Asia Cup match and most runs by an Indian (26) in 20th over of a T20I match.

98.title: Bihar Minister Kartikeya Singh, accused in kidnapping case, resigns from his post
98.article_body: Bihar Minister Kartikeya Singh, who is accused in the kidnapping of a builder in 2014, resigned from his post amid protests. Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has accepted his resignation and further sent it to the Governor. Singh was removed as the Law Minister of Bihar and allotted the sugarcane department on Wednesday morning.

99.title: 10-foot-long king cobra hid in car for a week, travelled 200 km in Kerala
99.article_body: A king cobra travelled in a car for over 200 km and lived in its engine bay for a week before being finally rescued by wildlife personnel in Kerala, according to the vehicle owner. The incident was reported from Kerala's Arpookara. The forest officials rescued the 10-foot-long snake from the compound of an individual, a video of which surfaced online.

100.title: Virat Kohli bowls in T20I cricket after 6 years, concedes 6 runs in an over
100.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli on Wednesday bowled an over against Hong Kong in their Asia Cup 2022 match. It is the first time since 2016 that Kohli bowled in a T20I match. He gave away six runs in his over. Kohli has bowled 25.2 overs in T20I cricket, taking four wickets for 204 runs.

101.title: Man steals 1-day-old infant from UP hospital by posing as hospital staff, video surfaces
101.article_body: A CCTV footage has surfaced online showing a man stealing a one-day-old infant from a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. A complaint has been filed by the parents of the infant, in which they mentioned that the man posed as a hospital staff member for stealing the baby. The police has formed a team to nab the accused.

102.title: Nikhil Siddhartha's 'Karthikeya 2' crosses ₹100 crore at box office
102.article_body: Nikhil Siddhartha shared that his film 'Karthikeya 2' has "crossed the ₹100 crore gross mark officially" at the box office. The actor thanked the audience for their "love and affection" for the film. "Will always try and work hard to live up to it," he wrote. The film is being screened on over 3,000 screens across India.

103.title: Michael Jackson wanted to be in The Sandman's TV version: Neil Gaiman
103.article_body: 'The Sandman' author Neil Gaiman revealed that Michael Jackson wanted to play Morpheus in the television version of the comic book series. Remembering his visit to Warner Bros in 1996, Neil said that the then-president of the production house told him that Michael had called them to ask if he could be a part of the television adaptation.

104.title: Would like to work with Vijay in Ajay Gnanamuthu directorial: Vikram
104.article_body: Tamil actor Chiyaan Vikram has shared that he would like to work with his contemporary Vijay under the direction of filmmaker Ajay Gnanamuthu. Vikram spoke about Vijay during a Twitter conversation, which was conducted on Tuesday to promote his film 'Cobra'. In response, director Ajay Gnanamuthu said he would be the first person to buy a ticket for the film.

105.title: Learned how to face camera from Kareena: Kiara
105.article_body: Kiara Advani said she "learned how to face the camera" from her 'Good Newwz' co-star Kareena Kapoor Khan. She said during the film's shoot, she used to be so involved in a scene that she would forget about camera angles. However, that never happened with Kareena. Kiara said Kareena "would know where the camera is, even if it's behind her".

106.title: S Korea may hold survey on BTS members' mandatory military service
106.article_body: South Korea is considering a survey to determine whether members of K-pop band BTS should be granted exemptions from mandatory military service, officials said. The Defence Ministry is examining the adequacy of such a study. The military service issue has been debated in the media recently as BTS's oldest member, Jin, faces enlistment at year-end, when he turns 30.

107.title: EU to toughen travel rules for Russian tourists, no ban imposed
107.article_body: European Union countries on Wednesday agreed to make it tougher for Russian citizens to enter the 27-nation bloc, but failed to develop consensus on imposing an outright ban on tourists. EU foreign ministers made the decision in retaliation to Russia's war on Ukraine. The plan is to lengthen the process to obtain short-term visas to enter Europe's passport-free travel zone.

108.title: Would have quit politics earlier if I knew it would be dirty: Mamata
108.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said that she would have quit politics much earlier if she was aware that it could get so dirty and her family and she would face slander. Her statement comes in reaction to a recent PIL filed at Calcutta High Court demanding probe by central agencies into the assets of her family members.

109.title: Dennis Woodside appointed as President of Freshworks
109.article_body: Nasdaq-listed software-as-a-service (SaaS) company Freshworks has appointed Dennis Woodside as the company's President, effective from September 1. Woodside will join the company's board of directors and will report to Freshworks CEO and Founder Girish Mathrubootham. Previously, he was President of Impossible Foods, and also worked at Dropbox and Google. At Freshworks, he will lead global business operations.

110.title: PM Modi performs 'aarti' at Piyush Goyal's residence on Ganesh Chaturthi
110.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi performed 'aarti' at the residence of Union Minister Piyush Goyal on the occasion of Ganesh Chaturthi on Wednesday. A video showed the PM greeting Goyal and others before offering prayers and performing 'aarti'. Sharing pictures from Goyal's residence, the PM tweeted, "May the blessings of Bhagwan Shri Ganesh always remain upon us."

111.title: Crediting Mughals for uniting India 'absurd and false': Baba Ramdev
111.article_body: Responding to Assam Congress MP Abdul Khaliq , who said that the Mughals were responsible for unification of India, Baba Ramdev said that crediting the Mughals for India's unification was 'absurd and false.' Calling the Mughals 'invaders,' Ramdev further added that glorifying them for uniting India 'shows a colonial mindset.' Khaliq had added that he was proud of the Mughals.

112.title: Healthcare facility for advocates to open soon: K'taka CM Bommai
112.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said healthcare facility for advocates would open soon, adding ₹800 crore would be spent to improve the judiciary's infrastructure. "This'll ensure good facilities in lower courts. As the population grows, court facilities must be upgraded," Bommai said. The government has given permission for having the bar associations in Shiggaon, Savanur and Haveri, he added.

113.title: Railways completes construction of 9.8 km tunnel in J&K
113.article_body: A 9.8-km tunnel on the 111-km under-construction Katra-Banihal railway link in Jammu and Kashmir has been completed, officials said. The tunnel connects Dugga and Sawlakote stations. The railway link is part of the 272-km Udhampur-Srinagar-Baramulla Railway Line (USBRL) project. The Katra-Banihal section includes 35 tunnels and 37 bridges.

114.title: Elephant dies at UP's Dudhwa National Park
114.article_body: An elephant, who was suffering from liver complications, has passed away at Uttar Pradesh's Dudhwa National Park, officials said. "The elephant was suffering from liver complications for the past three months," said Field director, Dudhwa, Sanjay Kumar Pathak. He added that the female elephant was given regular medications and despite that her condition did not improve.

115.title: SC to hear plea on mechanism to probe sexual harassment cases against judges
115.article_body: Supreme Court will hear a plea by a law intern on framing guidelines to probe sexual harassment cases against sitting and retired judges in November. It has also sought its Secretary-General's stand on the enquiry mechanism. While hearing the intern's sexual harassment complaint against an ex-judge in 2014, the court had noted that there's no enquiry mechanism for such complaints.

116.title: Hindus, Muslims come together to celebrate Ganesh Chaturthi in K'taka
116.article_body: People from Muslim and Hindu communities came together to celebrate Ganesh Chaturthi in Karnataka's Mandya district on Wednesday. As per reports, people from both the communities had gathered at Beedi Colony, which has a majority of Muslims. A video of their participation in the celebrations has emerged online. Notably, this comes amid Idgah ground dispute in Karnataka's Hubballi and Chamrajpet.

117.title: Internet shutdowns hit Lebanon as telecom workers go on strike
117.article_body: Major internet shutdowns hit cash-strapped Lebanon this week as employees of the state-owned telecom company went on strike, demanding increase in wages. Lebanon is experiencing one of its worst economic crises which has seen three-fourths of its 6-million population enter poverty level. The Lebanese pound lost over 90% of its value against the US dollar in the last three years.

118.title: Excessive flooding could lead to health crisis in Pakistan: WHO
118.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) on Wednesday warned that the excessive flooding in Pakistan this monsoon could lead to a health crisis. The rains have destroyed or damaged nearly 900 clinics and hospitals and damage to infrastructure has meant health services are not reaching remote areas. WHO has also said there is a possibility of waterborne diseases spreading rapidly.

119.title: No state funeral for Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev: Russian media
119.article_body: There will be no state funeral for the ex-president of the Soviet Union, Mikhail Gorbachev, Russian media reported on Wednesday. Gorbachev's funeral will reportedly take place inside Moscow's House of Unions and he will likely be buried at the city's Novodevichy Cemetery, next to his wife, Raisa, who died in 1999. The funeral will reportedly take place on Saturday.

120.title: Reliance Industries acquires soft drink brand Campa: Report
120.article_body: Reliance Industries has acquired soft drink brand Campa from Pure Drinks Group to add to its FMCG portfolio, as per reports. The deal is estimated to be ₹22 crore and Reliance is looking to re-launch Campa nationally by Diwali in three flavours. This will include its original Campa Cola, lemon and orange variants.

121.title: NPCI receives RBI nod to acquire 10% stake in ONDC
121.article_body: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has received clearance from Reserve Bank of India (RBI) and Union Ministry of Finance to acquire a 10% stake in Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC). Reportedly, Bank of India is also looking to acquire 5-7% stake in the company. ONDC currently has 17 stakeholders, and is aiming to have 20.

122.title: Russian missile strikes kill 22 at train station on Ukraine's Independence Day
122.article_body: At least 22 people were killed and several others wounded in Russian missile strikes on Chaplyne railway station in Ukraine on Wednesday, which was Ukraine's Independence Day. As per Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, rockets also hit a train following which four carriages caught fire. "We'll definitely make the occupiers bear responsibility for everything they have done," Zelenskyy stated.

123.title: BJP, BJYM workers try to gherao Chhattisgarh CM's house; 460 detained
123.article_body: Leaders and workers of BJP and its youth wing BJYM tried to gherao Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel's residence on Wednesday. They were protesting against alleged corruption and unemployment in Chhattisgarh. Police said 461 protesters, including MP Arun Sao, were briefly detained. Around 15 officers were injured while trying to control the protesters at various places in the state, police added.

124.title: Theft suspect in Gujarat's Vadodara dies in police custody
124.article_body: A theft suspect detained in Gujarat's Vadodara died in police custody, an official said. The man, identified as Bhupendra Solanki, was caught while committing theft at a residential society at Sevasi, a police official said. However, a resident of the area said that Solanki was his guest and lost his way when people caught him on suspicion.

125.title: CBI raids residence of Bengal university VC in recruitment scam case
125.article_body: The CBI on Wednesday raided the house and office of former SSC Chairman and present Vice Chancellor of University of North Bengal, Subires Bhattacharyya, in connection with the West Bengal teacher recruitment scam case. Notably, the Bag committee had mentioned Bhattacharyya's name in its report while probing the scam. Earlier, ex-minister Partha Chatterjee was arrested in connection with the case.

126.title: Assam Legislative Assembly autumn session to commence from Sept 12
126.article_body: The autumn session of the Assam Legislative Assembly will commence from September 12 and will continue till September 19. The monsoon session of the Assembly which began on July 18, ended four days ahead of its scheduled end date of August 12. The Governor of Assam, Prof Jagdish Mukhi, summoned the autumn session.

127.title: Even when we remember that today, we can't sleep: Kapil Dev on loss to Pakistan in 1986
127.article_body: Recalling the 1986 Austral-Asia Cup final which India lost to Pakistan after Javed Miandad slammed a last-ball six against Chetan Sharma, former India captain Kapil Dev said, "Even when we remember that today, we can't sleep." He added, "That defeat crushed the whole side's confidence for the next four years." He further said that the defeat wasn't Chetan's mistake.

128.title: It was really good: Danny DeVito on SS Rajamouli's 'RRR'
128.article_body: Actor Danny DeVito said he found SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' and Shahid Kapoor's 'R...Rajkumar' "really good". He said he loved how the Indian films "keep up the story even in the singing". Danny said whenever he can, he would like to convince the makers of his animated show 'Little Demon' to bust into a big number in the next season.

129.title: US sending fresh military aid to Ukraine worth nearly $3 billion
129.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Wednesday said he is sending fresh military aid worth $2.98 billion to Ukraine in its war against Russia. Biden said the support will help Ukraine acquire air defense systems, artillery systems, munitions, drones and other equipment. “The United States of America is committed to supporting the people of Ukraine as they...defend their sovereignty,” Biden said.

130.title: What is govt's new model for toll collection on highways?
130.article_body: The government is planning to replace toll plazas with Automatic Number Plate Reader (ANPR) cameras. As per the plan, the cameras will read high-security registration plates (HSRPs) on the vehicles and toll will be automatically deducted from the linked bank accounts of vehicle owners. The government is planning to bring a provision for all vehicles to have HSRPs.

131.title: My focus remains on how relatable my character can be: Pankaj
131.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi said the look of his character doesn't matter to him as an actor. He said his focus remains on creating characters that are so relatable that whenever the audience sees him on screen, they should feel they know someone similar. But for Pankaj, the trick is to do it "while maintaining a certain uniqueness about it".

132.title: F1 driver Daniel Ricciardo to leave McLaren after 2022 season
132.article_body: Formula One driver Daniel Ricciardo has announced that the current 2022 season will be his last year at McLaren. McLaren and Ricciardo have "mutually agreed" to terminate his contract one year early. The Australian had joined McLaren for 2021 on a three-year deal. Ricciardo is the only McLaren driver to have won a Formula One race in the last decade.

133.title: COVID-19 deaths fall by 15% worldwide: WHO in weekly report
133.article_body: The number of COVID-19 deaths dipped by 15% worldwide and new infections dropped by 9%, the World Health Organization (WHO) said in its weekly assessment on Wednesday. In total, the WHO said 5.3 million new cases and over 14,000 deaths were reported last week. The health body said number of new infections fell in every region, except the Western Pacific.

134.title: Nearly 500 schemes announced by Jayalalithaa shelved: AIADMK's EPS
134.article_body: Former Tamil Nadu CM and AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami on Wednesday criticised the ruling DMK and accused them of shelving nearly 500 projects announced by late AIADMK leader J Jayalalithaa. This deprives people of various welfare measures, he said. Expansion of Coimbatore airport and Avinashi Athikadavu water project were some of the schemes kept pending, he added.

135.title: TVS Motor buys 48% stake in Narain Karthikeyan’s startup DriveX
135.article_body: Two and three-wheeler manufacturer TVS Motor has invested in former Formula 1 driver Narain Karthikeyan's startup to acquire 48.27% stake. TVS has invested over ₹85 crore in DriveX (NKars Mobility Millennial Solutions Private Limited), a pre-owned two-wheeler platform. DriveX was founded in April 2020 and began as a two-wheeler subscription platform, and has since spread to five cities.

136.title: Pepperfry acquires Brandmakerr, appoints Rahul Kapuria as VP
136.article_body: Furniture e-commerce company Pepperfry has acquired commercial interior solutions company Brandmakerr for an undisclosed amount. Pepperfry has appointed Brandmakerr founder, Rahul Kapuria, as the Vice President. With this deal, Pepperfry said it will foray into commercial projects in retail, banking and HORECA (hotel, restaurant and cafe) sectors as this opens a new area of business for them.

137.title: Tropical Storm Ma-on moves towards southeast China
137.article_body: Tropical Storm Ma-on gathered force and headed towards Hong Kong and other parts of southeast China on Wednesday. Cities in Guangdong province closed high-speed rail and ferry services, workers on sea projects were evacuated and several flights were cancelled. The Hong Kong Observatory warned winds with mean speeds of 63 km/h or more were expected.

138.title: 'The Kapil Sharma Show' to air on TV from Sept 10: Reports
138.article_body: The new season of 'The Kapil Sharma Show' (TKSS) will reportedly air from September 10. While Archana Puran Singh, Sumona Chakravarti, Kiku Sharda and Chandan Prabhakar will return to the show, Kapil will reportedly introduce new comic actors in the upcoming season. Kapil had recently started shooting for the show. The first episode might host Akshay Kumar.

139.title: Smartphone recovered from woman prisoner in Indore jail, guard suspended
139.article_body: A smartphone was recovered from a 35-year-old woman lodged as an undertrial in the district prison of Madhya Pradesh's Indore, an official said on Wednesday. Following the recovery, a female guard was suspended, the official added. The prisoner was brought to Indore from Tihar Jail as a cheating case is pending against her in a local court, jail's superintendent said.

140.title: Secure release of fishermen arrested by Sri Lanka: Stalin to Centre
140.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Wednesday urged the central government to intervene and ensure fishermen arrested by Sri Lanka are released. Stalin wrote to External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar after 10 Indian fishermen were arrested and their boats seized on Monday for allegedly poaching in Lankan waters. Stalin said this was the fifth such incident since June this year.

141.title: Yamuna Expressway toll prices increased by up to ₹18.80 per km
141.article_body: Toll tariff on the Yamuna Expressway between Greater Noida and Agra has been increased between ₹2.60 and ₹18.80 per kilometre. Toll for car, jeep, van and light motor vehicles has been increased from ₹2.50 per kilometre to ₹2.65 per kilometre. It has been increased to ₹8.45 for bus or truck, while large size vehicles will be charged ₹18.80 per kilometre.

142.title: Lone JD(U) MLA in Arunachal Pradesh joins ruling BJP
142.article_body: Techi Kaso, the lone JD(U) legislator in Arunachal Pradesh, has joined the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP). There are now 49 BJP MLAs in the 60-member state Assembly. This comes after Bihar CM Nitish Kumar-led JD(U) broke alliance with BJP in Bihar. JD(U) had won seven seats in the 2019 state elections. However, six JD(U) MLAs joined BJP in 2020.

143.title: We'll continue protests till Raja Singh is arrested: AIMIM chief Owaisi
143.article_body: Condemning Telangana BJP MLA T Raja Singh's alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Wednesday demanded his arrest. "BJP and their MLA T Raja Singh issued a video expressing their hate against Prophet Muhammad," he said. "The Prophet lives in the hearts of Muslims...We will continue our protests till this MLA is arrested," he added.

144.title: Chile govt revives efforts to pass bill aimed to reduce working hours
144.article_body: The Chilean government said on Tuesday that it has revived efforts to pass legislation that would reduce weekly working hours. The bill, which aims to reduce the working week from 45 hours to 40 hours, was first introduced in the country's Congress in 2017. Lawmakers will debate a series of changes to the bill made by President Gabriel Boric's government.

145.title: Hyd court serves notice to BJP leaders in Kavitha's defamation case
145.article_body: A Hyderabad court served a notice to BJP leaders Parvesh Verma and Manjinder Sirsa in a defamation case filed by TRS MLC K Kavitha. Kavitha, who is Telangana CM Chandrashekar Rao's daughter, was accused of being the middleman between the liquor mafia and the Delhi government. The court directed the BJP leaders to not make defamatory statements in the media.

146.title: Virat Kohli meets Babar Azam ahead of India-Pakistan match, pic goes viral
146.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli met Pakistan captain Babar Azam at the stadium, where both the teams are preparing for their Asia Cup 2022 encounter, which will take place on August 28. The picture of the duo went viral on social media, with a fan writing, "Picture of the day." "Babar and Virat broke the internet," wrote another.

147.title: The idea of 'Liger' came to me because of Allu Arjun: Puri Jagannadh
147.article_body: Director Puri Jagannadh credited Allu Arjun for the idea behind 'Liger'. He said during the film 'Iddarammayilatho' (2013), Allu Arjun told him about a Hollywood director whose heroes always had some sort of disability. Puri said Arjun asked him to write such a character. "I suggested a hero who stammers and he liked it. That's how it started," he recalled.

148.title: Terrorism is 'crime against humanity': Rajnath Singh at SCO meet
148.article_body: Every form of terrorism, including cross-border terrorism, is a "crime against humanity", Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said at a Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) meet in Tashkent on Wednesday. Singh added that Afghan territory must not be used for terror activities. The SCO member states are India, China, Russia, Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, Tajikistan, Kyrgyzstan and Pakistan.

149.title: BJP's Vijay Kumar Sinha named LoP in Bihar Assembly after resigning as Speaker
149.article_body: Senior BJP leader and former Bihar Assembly Speaker Vijay Kumar Sinha was named as the Leader of the Opposition on Wednesday. Sinha resigned as the Speaker ahead of floor test on Wednesday morning. Earlier, the Leader of the Opposition was RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav, who is now the Deputy Chief Minister of Bihar.

150.title: The single hardest thing in my life: Vijay on Tollywood debut
150.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda said "probably the single hardest thing" in his life was to find a platform as an actor. Vijay said after finishing theatre, he thought of making his debut as a Tollywood actor but there was nowhere to go and "nobody was looking". He said he never lost hope and always believed he was meant for "something big".

151.title: UK PM Johnson meets Ukraine's Zelenskyy, announces military package
151.article_body: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Wednesday met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Kyiv to mark Ukraine's Independence Day. Johnson announced a £54 million military support package to the country on the occasion, which will include 2,000 drones. "The UK will continue to stand with our Ukrainian friends. I believe Ukraine can and will win this war," Johnson said.

152.title: Latin America should be a major business hub for India: S Jaishankar
152.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has stressed on the importance of making Latin America a major business hub for India. Jaishankar, who is on a six-day official visit to Paraguay, Brazil and Argentina, interacted with prominent businessmen in Sao Paulo on Tuesday. "Business is the ballast that provides steady sailing for relationships," Jaishankar said in a tweet after the meeting.

153.title: Lingusamy pays ₹10,000 fine, avoids jail time in cheque fraud case: Reports
153.article_body: The Chennai Saidapet Court reportedly gave director Lingusamy an option to pay ₹10,000 fine or do six months jail time in the cheque fraud case. Reportedly, Lingusamy opted to pay the fine to avoid jail sentence. The case was filed against Lingusamy and his brother Subash Chandra Bose by a production company after their cheque of over ₹1 crore bounced.

154.title: Pak Army Colonel gave me ₹30,000 to attack Indian Army: Terrorist captured by India
154.article_body: Tabarak Hussain, a terrorist who was captured by Indian Army on August 21, said he was sent to India on a suicide mission by a Colonel of the Pakistan Army, adding that he was offered around ₹30,000 to target Indian Army. He was arrested along the LoC in the Jhangar sector of Naushera in Rajouri when he tried to infiltrate.

155.title: Rekha wasn't convinced to be on 'Koffee With Karan': Karan Johar
155.article_body: Director Karan Johar said he once approached actress Rekha to appear on 'Koffee With Karan', but she "wasn't convinced". He said he didn't push her about it as he thought the "exotic, beautiful mystery about her" has to be protected always. When asked about Aditya Chopra, Karan said, "I think I'm not brave enough to even ask him."

156.title: Belarus wishes us 'peaceful skies' but lets rockets hit us: Ukraine
156.article_body: Ukraine on Wednesday rejected Belarusian leader Alexander Lukashenko's "cynical" Independence Day greeting. Lukashenko wished Ukrainians "peaceful skies, tolerance...and success in restoring a decent life". "Lukashenko truly believes the world doesn't notice his participation in crimes against Ukraine...He...wishes us a 'peaceful sky' [but lets] rockets...hit us," a senior Ukrainian official said.

157.title: Gurugram mall raided by CBI not mine, BJP MP inaugurated it: Tejashwi
157.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday denied that the mall raided by the CBI in Gurugram is owned by him. Further, he claimed that a BJP MP had inaugurated the mall. He stated that upon inquiring about the 'Urban Cubes' mall and the company behind it, he found that a resident of Haryana named Krishna Kumar is its director.

158.title: India A squad for four-day matches against New Zealand A announced
158.article_body: The BCCI on Wednesday announced the India A squad for the four-day matches against New Zealand A. The team will be led by Priyank Panchal. Kuldeep Yadav, Prasidh Krishna and Ruturaj Gaikwad, who were part of India's squad for the recently concluded ODI series against Zimbabwe, have also been included in the team. The team also features Umran Malik.

159.title: Ex-world no. 1 Angelique Kerber announces pregnancy, to miss US Open
159.article_body: Former world number one Angelique Kerber took to social media to announce her pregnancy. "I really wanted to play the US Open...eventually I decided that two against one just isn't a fair competition," she wrote. "Being a professional athlete means everything to me but I'm grateful for the new path I'm heading to," she added.

160.title: 2-time Wimbledon champ Kvitova gets engaged to her coach, shares pic
160.article_body: Two-time Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova took to social media to announce that she has got engaged to her coach Jiri Vanek. Sharing a picture from the All England Lawn Tennis Club, Kvitova wrote, "Happy news we wanted to share with you guys... I said 'yes' in my special place." Kvitova began working with Vanek in November 2016.

161.title: RJD, JD(U) going to have a never-ending partnership: Tejashwi Yadav
161.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday said that RJD and JD(U) are going to have a never-ending partnership and will be working for the development of the state and the country. Calling RJD-JD(U) politicians as cricketers, he said, "No one is getting run out this time." "This is going to be the longest inning," Tejashwi added.

162.title: BJP is all publicity & no work: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
162.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Wednesday took a jibe at BJP during a special session at Assembly and said that the party is all publicity and no work. "You (BJP MLAs) are all running away. You will only get a position in your party if you say things against me," said Nitish as BJP MLAs staged a walkout.

163.title: 7 injured in reactor blast at pharma company in Telangana; 1 critical
163.article_body: Seven people were injured after a reactor blast took place at a pharmaceutical company in the Nalgonda district of Telangana on Wednesday. All the injured persons were taken to a nearby hospital where at least one of them is critical, Nalgonda Superintendent of Police Rema Rajeshwari said. A case will be registered, the police officer added.

164.title: There's 'mafia raj' in every department of Chhattisgarh govt: Tejasvi Surya
164.article_body: National President of BJP Yuva Morcha Tejasvi Surya on Wednesday alleged there is a 'mafia raj' in every department and every ministry of the Bhupesh Baghel government in Chhattisgarh. "In the history of Chhattisgarh, this is the largest movement against the corrupt and insensitive Bhupesh Baghel government," Surya said. "Your time is up Bhupesh Ji," Surya added.

165.title: EV battery startup Neuron Energy partners with e-Ashwa Automotive
165.article_body: Electric vehicle battery manufacturing startup Neuron Energy has announced a strategic partnership with EV maker e-Ashwa Automotive. Neuron Energy supplies lithium-ion and lead acid batteries in India, and under the partnership, e-Ashwa will purchase 600 battery packs per month and 10,000 battery packs annually. The deal closed at an estimated amount of ₹2 crore monthly and ₹30 crore per year.

166.title: Alteria Capital in talks to raise ₹3,500 cr for 3rd fund: Report
166.article_body: Venture debt firm Alteria Capital is looking to raise ₹3,500 crore from its investors, for its third debt fund, as per a report. Alteria's talks for its third fund come less than a year after it raised around ₹1,800 crore. Alteria aims to have a dual fund structure of which it will raise ₹2,000 crore for primary venture debt.

167.title: Told an actor my mom is a fan, he said 'teri maa ke saath main kya karunga': Actress
167.article_body: TV actress Kanishka Soni has revealed that a legendary actor once told her "tumhari maa ke saath main kya karunga?" after she informed him that her mother was a huge fan of him. Soni recently claimed that she married herself, saying, "The only person I am in love with is myself...I don't need any man ever."

168.title: Record 130 Indian-Americans at key positions in US President Biden's administration
168.article_body: US President Joe Biden has appointed more than 130 Indian-Americans to key positions in his administration so far, the best representation from the community that makes up over 1% of the American population. Biden's predecessor Donald Trump had appointed more than 80 Indian-Americans, and Barack Obama had appointed over 60 Indian-Americans to key positions during his eight years in office.

169.title: Japan considers building new nuclear power plants
169.article_body: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida on Wednesday said a new generation of nuclear power plants could be built, signalling a shift in policy after the 2011 tsunami which destroyed the Fukushima nuclear plant. The push for nuclear fuel comes as global energy supplies are under strain. Nuclear energy is expected to help Japan reach its carbon neutrality goal by 2050.

170.title: BJP should disclose its source of money being used to poach MLAs: AAP
170.article_body: AAP's political affairs committee condemned the BJP's efforts to "poach" its MLAs and asked the party to disclose from where it accumulated the money to poach other legislators, party spokesperson Sanjay Singh said on Wednesday. "We want to assure the people that the Aam Aadmi Party government in Delhi is stable," Singh said.

171.title: Kejriwal calls special Assembly session on Aug 26 amid horse-trading claims
171.article_body: The Arvind Kejriwal-led Delhi government has called a special session of the Assembly on August 26 (Friday) over claims that BJP is trying to lure AAP MLAs. The Assembly session is scheduled to be held from 11 am. Earlier in the day, AAP MP Sanjay Singh claimed that BJP offered four AAP MLAs ₹20 crore each if they switched sides.

172.title: Researchers develop artificial leaves that produce clean fuel from sunlight
172.article_body: Researchers from the University of Cambridge have developed ultra-thin and flexible artificial leaves that generate clean fuels using sunlight and water. Inspired by the process of photosynthesis, these leaves can split water into hydrogen and oxygen or reduce carbon dioxide to syngas or synthetic gas, a mixture of carbon monoxide and hydrogen that can be used as fuel.

173.title: Journalist Siddique Kappan moves SC seeking bail in UAPA case
173.article_body: Journalist Siddique Kappan, booked under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA), has moved the Supreme Court seeking bail. "[He] has spent almost two years behind bars...only because he sought to discharge his professional duty of reporting on the infamous case of the Hathras rape and murder," the plea stated. It claimed that Kappan was arrested on the basis of "trumped-up charges".

174.title: BJP more brutal than British, undeclared Emergency since 2014: Patole
174.article_body: Maharashtra Congress president Nana Patole on Wednesday criticised the BJP, alleging that it was working in a "more brutal way" than the British rulers and claimed that India was under an undeclared Emergency since 2014. "BJP is misusing CBI, ED and Income Tax systems to gain political advantage. The party is restless after losing power in Bihar," he alleged.
