175.title: Holistic healthcare a priority: PM at inauguration of cancer hospital
175.article_body: At the inauguration of the Homi Bhabha Cancer Hospital and Research Centre in Mohali, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that the Centre has been prioritising holistic healthcare since it came to power. PM Modi added that the healthcare of a country can be strengthened when hospitals provide solutions to problems. Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann felicitated the PM at the inauguration.

176.title: Maha govt will make anti-conversion law more stringent: Fadnavis
176.article_body: After BJP MLA Nitesh Rane cited alleged religious conversion of Hindu women in Maharashtra, Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said the state government will make efforts to make the provisions of anti-conversion law stringent. "No one can carry out conversion with coercion," Fadnavis said. Rane alleged on the pretext of religious conversion, atrocities were committed against a minor in Ahmednagar.

177.title: The Swiss Alps have lost 50% of their glaciers in 80 years: Study
177.article_body: The Swiss Alps have lost nearly 50% of their glaciers in the last 80 years, a study has found. The scientists used images from the early 20th century to quantify how the climate crisis has impacted the mountains over the past eight decades. On average, the Alps have lost 0.73 cubic kilometres of ice per year, the researchers have found.

178.title: Constable asks man to deboard ladies' compartment in Chennai, stabbed
178.article_body: A Railway Protection Force (RPF) woman constable was stabbed by a man on a suburban train in Chennai on Tuesday after she asked him to deboard the compartment designated for female commuters. The man who stabbed the constable, identified as Asirva, on her neck then jumped from the train and fled. Asirva is currently undergoing treatment at a private hospital.

179.title: PM Modi to attend state funeral of ex-Japan PM Abe on Sept 27: Reports
179.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will attend the state funeral of ex-Japanese PM Shinzo Abe on September 27 in Tokyo, Japanese media has reported. PM Modi, who shared close ties with Abe, will then hold a meeting with Japanese PM Fumio Kishida, reports have stated. Abe was shot dead by an assassin while delivering a speech in Nara city on July 8.

180.title: FDs are from my income, opened when I didn't even know Chandrashekar existed: Jacqueline
180.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez, who has been named as accused in a ₹200-crore extortion case, told authorities that her attached Fixed Deposits (FDs) were not created by using alleged proceeds of crime. She stated that the deposits are from her own legitimate income and were opened before she knew that the main accused Chandrashekar "even existed in the world".

181.title: Laxman named interim head coach for Asia Cup, Dravid to join after testing COVID -ve
181.article_body: VVS Laxman has been named India's interim head coach for Asia Cup, to be played in UAE. Laxman will oversee the team's preparation in the absence of regular head coach Rahul Dravid, who tested COVID-19 positive before the team's departure to UAE. Dravid will join the team once he tests negative and is cleared by the medical team, BCCI said.

182.title: Bangladeshi national lynched over suspicion of cattle theft in WB, 3 held
182.article_body: A Bangladeshi man was lynched in a village in West Bengal's Jalpaiguri on Wednesday after he was caught while allegedly trying to steal cows from a house, police said. Three people have been arrested in connection with the lynching. According to police, a gang of people from Bangladesh crossed the border with the intention of theft at Baruapara on Tuesday.

183.title: You can't run this far in your career without having abilities: Kohli on criticism
183.article_body: Ex-India captain Virat Kohli, who has been criticised over his poor form, said, "I know where my game stands." He added, "You cannot run this far in your international career without having...ability to counter situations and counter conditions and counter different kinds of bowling." Kohli stated, "When I come out of this phase...I know how consistent I can be."

184.title: American Express allowed to on-board new card customers in India as RBI lifts ban
184.article_body: American Express Banking Corp has been permitted to on-board new card customers in India as the RBI lifted the business restrictions. RBI had imposed the restrictions on American Express last year for non-compliance with the RBI circular dated April 6, 2018 on Storage of Payment System Data. The ban has now been lifted due to "satisfactory compliancy", the RBI said.

185.title: Dugongs functionally extinct in China: Study
185.article_body: A study published in the journal Royal Society Open Science has claimed that the Dugong, has gone functionally extinct in China. Researchers conducted several interviews in fishing communities across the country for the study. The Dugong, also known as the 'sea cow', is similar to the American manatee and can grow to about 3.4 metres in length.

186.title: James Cameron's 'Avatar' to re-release in theaters on Sept 23
186.article_body: Months before the release of 'Avatar: The Way of Water', the makers have announced the re-release of 2009 film 'Avatar'. The first part of the James Cameron's directorial franchise will return to the theatres on September 23. The makers announced the news on Wednesday with a new trailer of the Oscar-winning film.

187.title: IRCTC, Twitter officials to depose before Parliament panel on data security
187.article_body: A Parliamentary panel has called officials of Railways' catering arm IRCTC and social network company Twitter to depose before it on the handling of customer data. The Parliamentary Standing Committee on Information Technology will be chaired by Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Friday. This comes after IRCTC recently floated a tender to hire a consultant to monetise its passenger data.

188.title: Vijay joins Shah Rukh Khan on 'Jawan' sets, pic surfaces
188.article_body: Tamil actor Vijay has reportedly joined the sets of Shah Rukh Khan's 'Jawan' to shoot for his cameo appearance in the Atlee directorial. A picture, which has leaked from the sets, is going viral on the social media. It shows SRK and Vijay in a conversation with Atlee. As per reports, Vijay has not charged any money for his cameo.

189.title: NIA raids multiple locations in Delhi, other places in Mundra drug case
189.article_body: The NIA conducted multiple raids in Delhi and other cities in connection with its probe into the Mundra Port drug seizure case. Nearly 3,000 kg of heroin worth around ₹20,000 crore was seized in Gujarat's Mundra port last year. The raids were also conducted in multiple locations in Gujarat, Tamil Nadu, Kolkata and Punjab.

190.title: CBI, ED & IT dept are BJP's 3 'jamais': Tejashwi Yadav on raids
190.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav has called the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI), Enforcement Directorate (ED) and Income Tax Department (IT) three "jamais" (sons-in-law) of BJP. "When I go [abroad], BJP issues lookout notices...and when fraudsters like Nirav Modi run away, they do [nothing]," he said. CBI raided a property owned by Yadav in connection with a 'land-for-job' scam today.

191.title: Hyd Police auction 1,150 seized, abandoned vehicles; fetch ₹64 lakh
191.article_body: Hyderabad City Police auctioned 1,150 seized and abandoned vehicles on Tuesday, which brought in ₹64,63,200. Of the 1,150 vehicles up for auction, 1,060 abandoned scrap vehicles fetched ₹53,05,000. Around 82 roadworthy vehicles were auctioned for ₹11,58,200 in the auction. The vehicles were auctioned after their registered owners failed to claim them despite being notified via press releases.

192.title: Fire truck not deployed after tree fell in Pune college; probe on
192.article_body: Pune fire brigade department has initiated an inquiry into the incident where a fire officer from Janta Vasahat Fire Station reached Pune's SP College on a bike after a 30-foot-tall tree fell on the campus on Monday. "[He] did not send a fire brigade vehicle," a department official said. A 49-year-old gardener died after being injured during the incident.

193.title: China changes ending of latest 'Minions' movie
193.article_body: Censors in China have changed the ending of the latest 'Minions' movie, 'Minions: The Rise of Gru'. In the international version, Gru and Wild Knuckles, the movies' two thief anti-heroes, escape punishment after Knuckles fakes his own death. However, the version shown to Chinese viewers includes a note stating that Wild Knuckles was arrested and served 20 years in jail.

194.title: Proud to hear TN govt schemes appreciated by President & VP: Stalin
194.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Wednesday said he was proud to hear President Droupadi Murmu and Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar appreciating the schemes being implemented in Tamil Nadu and the state's overall progress. Various states are trying to copy the development schemes of the DMK government, but some political parties in the state were criticising the regime, Stalin said.

195.title: Complaint filed against 'Laal...', 'Shabaash Mithu' for 'ridiculing' disability community
195.article_body: Dr Satendra Singh, Co-founder of Doctors with Disabilities, has filed a complaint against 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Shabaash Mithu' for "ridiculing and mocking" the entire disability community. The complaint was filed with the Court of Chief Commissioner for Persons with Disabilities. As per Satendra, the court has issued a notice to the makers of the two films on his complaint.

196.title: Who is Natalia, the Ukrainian woman accused of blowing up Russian nationalist's daughter?
196.article_body: Ukrainian woman Natalia Vovk who has been accused of blowing up a Russian nationalist's daughter is a veteran of Mariupol's Azov Battalion turned spy, according to Russia's FSB. Natalia spent weeks tracking Darya Dugina before planting explosives under driver's seat of her car. Natalia arrived in Russia on July 23, together with her daughter Sofya Shaban, according to FSB.

197.title: India's Shubman Gill jumps 93 spots in latest ODI rankings
197.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday released the latest rankings, with India's Shubman Gill jumping 93 spots in the rankings for ODI batters. The 22-year-old is now ranked 38th after finishing as the leading run-scorer in the three-match ODI series against Zimbabwe with 245 runs. Virat Kohli, who is ranked fifth, remains the top-ranked Indian ODI batter, followed by Rohit Sharma (sixth).

198.title: Huge sunspot on Sun's surface grows 10 times in size in 48 hours, pic surfaces
198.article_body: A huge sunspot on the Sun's surface has grown 10 times in size in the last 48 hours. The sunspot, called AR3085, is also shooting off several minor solar flares. Sunspots are areas that appear dark on the surface of the Sun. They appear dark because they are cooler than other parts of the Sun's surface, as per NASA.

199.title: South Korea breaks its own record for world's lowest fertility rate
199.article_body: South Korea has broken its own record for the world's lowest fertility rate. Korean women were estimated, based on 2021 data, to have an average of just 0.81 children over their lifetimes, down from 0.84 a year earlier. South Korea's population will fall by 53% to 24 million by 2100, as per an analysis.

200.title: Lalu Yadav acquitted in 2015 poll code violation case
200.article_body: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav was acquitted by the civil court in Bihar's Hajipur on Wednesday in the 2015 poll code violation case on grounds of lack of evidence. Yadav was accused of making casteist remarks during a campaign supporting his son Tejashwi. He had allegedly called the Assembly election a direct fight between "the backward castes and forward castes".

201.title: 95 kg sandalwood worth ₹3.91 lakh seized by Pune Police; 5 arrested
201.article_body: Pune Police seized 95 kg of sandalwood worth ₹3.91 lakh on Tuesday and arrested five people from Sinhagad road area. Crime branch officials had reportedly laid a trap for the culprits at PL Deshpande Garden. "This gang targeted sandalwood trees on [the] premises of National Defence Academy, Film and Television Institute of India and other government offices," police said.

202.title: 3 killed, 2 injured after car falls into ditch in UP's Jaunpur
202.article_body: Police on Wednesday said three people were killed and two others were injured when their car lost balance, overturned and fell into a ditch in Uttar Pradesh's Jaunpur. The accident occurred on Tuesday night when they were returning after attending a wedding. Police said 29-year-old Shaklain and 23-year-old Sarvjeet died on the spot and 25-year-old Ayush Srivastava succumbed to injuries.

203.title: Prabhas' action-thriller with director Maruthi to go on floors in November
203.article_body: Director Maruthi has confirmed that his upcoming supernatural action-thriller with Prabhas will go on floors in November. "He (Prabhas) is doing two-three projects and is very busy. So, according to his dates and comfort, we have to start," he said. Maruthi said the Prabhas starrer is a big film, which will be shot entirely in India.

204.title: Policeman bludgeons 8-month-pregnant wife to death in J&K's Kathua
204.article_body: A Special Police Officer (SPO) allegedly bludgeoned his eight-month-pregnant wife to death on Tuesday in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district. According to police, the accused, who was on leave for the past three days, brutally murdered his wife following an argument over a domestic issue and fled the spot. Angry villagers also reportedly set his house on fire.

205.title: Hong Kong court refuses to recognise overseas same-sex marriages
205.article_body: A Hong Kong court has rejected an appeal to recognise same-sex marriages of those people who've legally wed overseas. Offering such recognition would "create an inherent incompatibility" between them and gay couples who cannot legally marry in Hong Kong, the judges ruled. The appeal was lodged by an LGBTQ and pro-democracy activist who married his partner in US in 2013.

206.title: Kejriwal calls meeting of AAP MLAs tomorrow amid ED & CBI raids on party leaders
206.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has called a meeting of all AAP MLAs at his residence at 11am on Thursday regarding the discussion on the current political scenario and ED and CBI raids on AAP leaders. AAP has alleged that BJP is attempting to overthrow the Delhi government. Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has claimed some MLAs were threatened to break AAP.

207.title: Exploded with love and joy: Karan on Bipasha Basu's pregnancy
207.article_body: Karan Singh Grover said his body "exploded with love and joy" when he got to know about his wife Bipasha Basu's pregnancy. Karan said he feels gratitude to be witnessing Bipasha "creating a life within her and making it look like it's all just a part of her day". Earlier, Karan described the child as a "creation manifested by love".

208.title: AIMIM demands Raja Singh's ouster from T'gana Assembly over Prophet row
208.article_body: The AIMIM on Wednesday wrote a letter to the Telangana Legislative Assembly's Speaker, demanding the expulsion of Goshamahal MLA Raja Singh over his alleged objectionable remarks against Prophet Muhammad. "Raja Singh has repeatedly conducted himself in a manner that is unbecoming of a member of the house," the letter read. Singh's comments have hurt Muslims across India, it further read.

209.title: Servify raises $65 million in Series D round, aims for IPO in 2 years
209.article_body: Servify, a platform that manages after-sales experience for smartphone vendors such as Apple and Samsung, has raised $65 million in its Series D funding round. The round was led by Singularity Growth Opportunity Fund. Founder Sreevathsa Prabhakar said that they were closing in on a $1-billion valuation and are aiming to go public in about 18 to 24 months.

210.title: IIT alumni-founded Loopworm raises $3.4 mn in seed funding round
210.article_body: Agri-biotechnology firm Loopworm has raised $3.4 million in an early-stage seed funding round. The round was led by Omnivore and WaterBridge Ventures and saw participation from Titan Capital and other angel investors. Founded in 2019 by IIT Roorkee graduates Ankit Alok Bagaria and Abhi Gawri, Loopworm upcycles food waste into protein-rich nutrients and value-added ingredients using insect farming.

211.title: Congress' official YouTube channel deleted
211.article_body: The Congress on Wednesday tweeted, "Our YouTube channel - 'Indian National Congress' has been deleted. We are fixing it and have been in touch with Google/YouTube teams." "We are investigating what caused this - a technical glitch or sabotage. Hope to be back soon," the party added.

212.title: Maha BJP MLA Rane demands anti-conversion law to protect Hindu women
212.article_body: BJP MLA Nitish Rane has demanded an anti-conversion law in Maharashtra, citing the alleged religious conversion of Hindu women. Rane said that Hindu women who marry Muslim men are kidnapped and sold, adding that people who engage in such unlawful activities are compensated financially. Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis has assured that the anti-conversion bill will be introduced, Rane added.

213.title: Being forced to pay 50% commission for projects: BBMP contractors
213.article_body: Contractors working on projects of Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) have alleged they are being forced to pay 50% commission for getting approvals to complete the projects. In a letter to BBMP chief Tushar Girinath, BBMP Working Contractors Association said commissions are being demanded in all municipal offices. Contractors were not paid in the last 22 months, the letter added.

214.title: Delhi's Springdales School gets included in World Book of Records
214.article_body: New Delhi's Springdales School has been felicitated with the Certificate of Excellence by the World Book of Records, said Barrister Santosh Shukla, President and CEO, World Book of Records. The school organised a mass event, in which 800 students did a round of 11 Surya Namaskars sitting on a chair.

215.title: MP man cuts his vein, climbs on tower after wife refuses to return home
215.article_body: A man from Madhya Pradesh first cut his vein and then climbed on top of a tower after his wife refused to return from her maternal home. In a video that has now gone viral on the internet, the man can be seen sitting in the middle of the tower and asking the police to get his wife back.

216.title: Move to stifle media: Congress on Adani's NDTV takeover bid
216.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh on Wednesday said the Adani Group's bid to acquire a controlling stake in media company NDTV could "stifle any semblance of an independent media". Adani Group's AMG Media has acquired 29.18% stake in NDTV and will launch an offer for another 26%. Ramesh alluded to billionaire Gautam Adani as PM Narendra Modi's "khaas dost" (special friend).

217.title: B'luru-based company launches API to alert users of severe weather events
217.article_body: A Bengaluru-based climate-intelligence company, Ambee, on Wednesday launched a new API to alert users of severe weather events such as hurricanes, storms and heatwaves, among others. "It is critical to consider the causes of these events, as well as their relationship to climate change and how various environmental factors interact with one another," a statement from Ambee read.

218.title: Link road in east Bengaluru to be closed from Aug 25 for rail works
218.article_body: A link road in east Bengaluru from Frazer Town (Pulakeshinagar) to Richards Town traversing the rail lines between Bengaluru Cantonment and Bengaluru East stations will be closed from Thursday (August 25). The road is expected to be closed for a few months to facilitate the quadrupling of the railway line. All types of vehicle movements are being restricted, police said.

219.title: Video shows UP lineman cutting power to police station after being fined
219.article_body: A traffic policeman reportedly issued a challan of ₹6,000 to a contractual lineman of Electricity Department in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli. Upset with this, he, along with other employees, allegedly cut off the electricity supply to the police station, citing high outstanding bills. A video of the incident showing a lineman climbing a pole to disconnect the supply went viral online.

220.title: Hyderabad may get 'Wind Garden' to lower temperatures and cool city
220.article_body: Hyderabad may soon get a 'Wind Garden' similar to the one in Madrid, Spain. Tagging a tweet by Madrid administration on Twitter, Telangana Municipal Administration and Urban Development Minister K T Rama Rao said, "Let's try this in Hyderabad @arvindkumar_ias, Get details and explore our HMDA urban parks for this." A Wind Garden can help lower temperatures in the city.

221.title: Stop work on Aarey forest until next hearing: SC tells Mumbai Metro
221.article_body: Supreme Court on Wednesday directed Mumbai Metro to not carry out any work on Aarey forest until the next hearing. "The counsel for MMRCL submits that her clients have already filed an affidavit that no trees have been or would be cut in any manner," a three-judge bench said. The counsel for Maharashtra government has sought time to collate documents.

222.title: UK will be a lifelong friend to Ukraine: Sunak on Ukraine's I-Day
222.article_body: UK PM candidate Rishi Sunak wrote a letter on Ukraine's Independence Day, August 24, praising the country's "steadfast courage", adding that UK will remain a "lifelong friend" to Ukraine. "We'll prioritise building cultural...and business links between our...nations to help [Ukraine] thrive as an independent country," he wrote. Notably, August 24 also marks six months since Russia invaded Ukraine.

223.title: Cottonmouth snake eats python at US zoo; pic of X-ray goes viral
223.article_body: The Zoo Miami in US posted a picture of an X-ray showing a python inside a cottonmouth snake. "You can see the spine and the transmitter of the python inside of the cottonmouth on this X-ray, or radiograph, that was taken at Zoo Miami's animal hospital," the zoo wrote along with the viral picture.

224.title: Outgoing Bihar Speaker did not want a Dalit to preside over House: Dy Speaker
224.article_body: Outgoing Bihar Assembly Speaker VK Sinha nominated JD(U) leader Narendra Narayan Yadav to chair the post-lunch Assembly session after resigning on Wednesday. State Deputy Speaker Maheshwar Hazari said, "It appears that [Sinha] did not want a Dalit to preside over the House…By denying me the opportunity, he…insulted Dalits." However, Yadav later announced that Hazari shall preside over the session.

225.title: Mumbai court denies bail to man who raped 80-yr-old paralysed woman
225.article_body: A Mumbai court has denied bail to a 26-year-old man who was arrested for raping an 80-year-old paralysed woman in 2020. The victim's daughter-in-law, who's the informant in the case, had 'settled' the matter outside the court and hence the accused should be considered for bail, his lawyer had argued. The court, however, noted that such a settlement is "irrelevant".

226.title: Gill's performances are putting 'pressure' on Shikhar Dhawan: Styris
226.article_body: Ex-New Zealand cricketer Scott Styris said Shubman Gill's performances in ODI cricket are putting "pressure" on Shikhar Dhawan. "There aren't too many top-order left-handers who are taking the game by the scruff of the neck in Indian cricket as an opener, and...Dhawan has that going in his favour," added Styris. Gill was the leading run-scorer in the ODIs against Zimbabwe.

227.title: It 'isn't right' to compare Kohli and Babar Azam: Rajkumar Sharma
227.article_body: Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said it is not right to compare Kohli and Pakistan captain Babar Azam currently, as the former has played a lot more cricket. "Even in T20Is, the difference is 25 matches which takes almost two years to cover," added Rajkumar. Ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram earlier stated that it is too early to compare them.

228.title: Edtech firm BrightCHAMPS acquires Singapore-based Schola for $15 mn
228.article_body: Edtech firm BrightCHAMPS has announced the acquisition of Singapore-based company Schola in a $15 million cash and stock deal. In June 2022, the startup backed by entrepreneur Binny Bansal announced that it had allocated $100 million to make edtech acquisitions across the US, UK, Southeast Asia, North Africa and the Middle East. BrightCHAMPS earlier acquired edtech startup Education10x.

229.title: Gang looting app cab drivers at knifepoint busted in Mumbai, 4 held
229.article_body: The Mumbai Police on Tuesday arrested four members of a gang allegedly involved in robbing app cab drivers at knifepoint by taking them to isolated streets. Police said they formed a team after a victim, Aziz Ansari, filed a complaint on Monday claiming he was robbed at knifepoint. The team laid a trap in Shivaji Nagar and arrested the accused.

230.title: Sri Lanka bans import of chocolates, perfumes amid economic crisis
230.article_body: Sri Lanka's finance ministry has banned the import of 300 consumer items including chocolates, perfumes, shampoos and makeup products. The decision comes as Sri Lanka continues to face its worst economic crisis since independence in 1948. According to the regulation, items which were shipped before August 23 and arrive before September 14 would be allowed.

231.title: TMC's Anubrata sent to 14-day judicial custody in cattle smuggling case
231.article_body: The CBI Special Court on Wednesday sent TMC's Birbhum district chief Anubrata Mondal to 14-day judicial custody in connection with the 2020 cattle smuggling case. Earlier, the court had sent Mondal to CBI custody till August 20. He was arrested from his residence in Bolpur on August 11 after he failed to appear for questioning twice in three days.

232.title: Residents can apply for municipal swimming pool membership online: BMC
232.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has said Mumbai residents can apply for membership for municipal swimming pools online. As part of the first phase, annual membership will be given to 6,000 Mumbaikars for four swimming pools. "The decision...was taken considering...busy lives of Mumbaikars that make it difficult to visit the swimming pools for filling of forms in person," BMC stated.

233.title: No mercy for killers of Russian nationalist Dugin's daughter: Lavrov
233.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Tuesday there can be "no mercy" for those behind a car bombing that killed Darya Dugina, the daughter of pro-Kremlin nationalist and President Vladimir Putin's aide Alexander Dugin. "The investigation will...be completed soon," Lavrov said. It is speculated that Alexander Dugin, who's known as 'Putin's brain', was the intended target of the attack.

234.title: CM Nitish Kumar-led 'Mahagathbandhan' govt proves majority in Bihar as BJP MLAs walk out
234.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar-led  'Mahagathbandhan' government on Wednesday proved its majority as BJP MLAs walked out of the Assembly. Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said, "We're cricketers and this pair (RJD and JDU) is going to have a never-ending partnership." Earlier this month, CM Kumar ended his government's alliance with BJP and joined hands with RJD and other 'Mahagathbandhan' parties.

235.title: I'm not going to give up: Mayank Agarwal on his international future
235.article_body: Indian batter Mayank Agarwal has said he has not given up on his future in international cricket. "I'm going to keep chasing it and improve my game with each passing day," he added. Mayank is the highest run-scorer in the ongoing Maharaja T20 Trophy and has scored two centuries in the tournament so far.

236.title: Police bust fake educational certificates racket in Hyderabad, 6 held
236.article_body: The Rachakonda Police on Tuesday busted a fake educational certificates racket and arrested six persons in connection with the case. "So far, the gang supplied educational certificates and Letter of Recommendation to around 500 persons," Police Commissioner said. Efforts are on to arrest another accused, who is currently absconding, police added.

237.title: Commerce Dept revamp to achieve $2 trillion exports by 2030: Goyal
237.article_body: Union Minister for Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal on Tuesday released a transformative plan for the Commerce Department with a focus on a dedicated trade promotion body and digitisation of trade facilitation processes, among others. The aim is to make the Indian Trade Service "future ready" and help achieve the $2-trillion export target by 2030, Goyal said.

238.title: Privacy complaint filed against Google over unsolicited ad emails
238.article_body: By sending unsolicited advertising emails directly to the inbox of Gmail users, Google has breached a European Union court ruling, Austrian advocacy group noyb.eu (None Of Your Business) said on Wednesday. The group filed a complaint with the French data protection authority, CNIL, saying that Google should seek prior permission from Gmail users before sending them any direct marketing emails.

239.title: Apple confirms delaying release of iPadOS 16
239.article_body: Apple has delayed the release of iPadOS 16 and it will be rolled out as version 16.1 in a free software update. Reports have it that the new multitasking system built into the iPadOS 16 needs more time to get fixed. While the iOS is expected to be rolled out in September, the new OS could get an October release.

240.title: AAP trying to deflect BJP's questions on malpractices in excise policy: Sambit Patra
240.article_body: Alleging that AAP is trying to deflect BJP's questions on malpractices in the implementation of the excise policy, BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said the Delhi government ignored the advice of the expert panel to gain "an unfair advantage in Punjab polls". AAP handed over wholesale liquor business to private players despite the expert panel recommending against it, he added.

241.title: Model who posed topless while kissing female friend at Finland PM's home posts apology
241.article_body: The model who posed topless while kissing her female friend in Finnish Prime Minister Sanna Marin's official residence has apologised in a post on Instagram. Sabina Särkkä wrote, "I published an inappropriate picture that should not have been taken. I am deeply sorry and apologise for my behaviour." Earlier, Marin apologised for the picture.

242.title: BJP will be finished in 5 yrs, downfall started from Bihar: AIUDF MLA
242.article_body: All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) chief Karim Uddin Barbhuiya stated on Wednesday that Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) will be finished in five-six years. BJP's downfall has started from Bihar, the Assam MLA added. This comes after Bihar CM Nitish Kumar broke ties with BJP. Barbhuiya further claimed that many Congress leaders will join AIUDF on September 2 in Barpeta.

243.title: Ex-Hyderabad Mayor Bonthu Rammohan booked in cheating case
243.article_body: Police on Tuesday booked former Hyderabad Mayor Bonthu Rammohan under sections of the SC/ST Atrocities Act as well for cheating and attempted extortion. According to the police, the complainant Bommaku Murali alleged that Rammohan used his political clout to cheat him out of a land transaction worth about ₹4 crore and also abused him in the name of caste.

244.title: Jaiveer Shergill quits Congress, says 'I've been seeking time from Gandhis for a year'
244.article_body: Congress national spokesperson Jaiveer Shergill on Wednesday said he has resigned from all party posts. He said, "I've been seeking time from Rahul Gandhi, Sonia Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra for more than a year, but we are not welcomed in the office." He added, "The decision-making of the Congress party is not in sync with the ground reality anymore."

245.title: Milind Soman meets PM Modi, gifts him Krishna idol from Vrindavan
245.article_body: Actor Milind Soman met Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Delhi. Taking to Instagram, he shared pictures of the meeting. "I thanked him for all he is doing to encourage people to take up yoga and Ayurveda across the country," Milind captioned the post. "Gifted him a Balakrishna that Ankita Konwar brought from Vrindavan during Janmashtami," he added.

246.title: Biggest challenge for Rohit is players who haven't played regularly: Bangar
246.article_body: Ex-India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said the "biggest challenge" for India captain Rohit Sharma in the upcoming Asia Cup is the players who've not played regularly. "It could be fitness or like Virat Kohli took a break, [who's] also making a comeback. KL Rahul had gotten injured," stated Bangar. India will begin their campaign against Pakistan on August 28.

247.title: Users complain of random celebrity posts on Facebook feed, company says 'error fixed'
247.article_body: Several users on Wednesday complained of facing a glitch on Facebook wherein their feeds showed random celebrity posts. These posts were taking over users’ main feed and suppressing the usual stream of images and videos shared by their friends. Meanwhile, a Facebook spokesperson said the bug was caused by a configuration change and the company has now fixed the error.

248.title: Govt, LIC consider selling 51% stake of IDBI Bank: Reports
248.article_body: The central government and the Life Insurance Corporation (LIC), who together own about 94% of IDBI Bank's shares, are considering selling at least 51% of the bank's stake, according to reports. At the existing market capitalisation, 51% stake in IDBI Bank amounts to ₹22,017 crore. The government is also likely to keep some shares of the bank after the sale.

249.title: Bawled throughout: Kevin Smith on Ben Affleck & Jennifer’s wedding
249.article_body: Ben Affleck's close friend Kevin Smith opened up about the actor's second wedding ceremony with Jennifer Lopez at his Georgia property. Kevin said the ceremony was "one of the most beautiful events" he has ever been a part of. He said, "I bawled throughout because it was so goddamn beautiful." Ben and Jennifer's second wedding took place on August 20.

250.title: The winner of India-Pak match will win the Asia Cup: Shane Watson
250.article_body: Ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said Pakistan are "high on confidence" ahead of the Asia Cup match against India on August 28, having defeated the latter by 10 wickets in T20 World Cup 2021. "When their confidence is high, they're nearly unstoppable," added Watson. "Whoever wins that game is going to go on and win the Asia Cup," he stated.

251.title: Felicitating Bilkis Bano convicts was in ‘absolute bad taste’: Retd Judge
251.article_body: Felicitation of the convicts in the Bilkis Bano case by some people was in "absolute bad taste", said retired judge UD Salvi, the judge who convicted the accused 14 years ago. "The state has the right to grant remission. It's a power given to the state under law," Salvi said, adding that he did nothing special in convicting them.

252.title: TMC removes Tripura unit chief Subal Bhowmik ahead of Assembly polls
252.article_body: The TMC on Wednesday removed its Tripura chief Subal Bhowmik ahead of the 2023 Assembly elections. TMC announced that former West Bengal minister Rajib Banerjee and Rajya Sabha MP Sushmita Dev will look after party operations till the new president is appointed. While the reason behind the move is unknown, reports suggested that Bhowmik might soon join BJP or Congress.

253.title: No evidence of Indian companies evading sanctions imposed on Russia: US
253.article_body: US Deputy Secretary of Treasury Wally Adeyemo on Wednesday said there is "no evidence of Indian companies circumventing the sanctions imposed on Russia" following the invasion of Ukraine. He further said that companies around the world, including those in India, the US and Europe, are taking the sanctions seriously and implementing them as well.

254.title: Cab drivers in B'luru working more at night to skip traffic: Report
254.article_body: Cab drivers in Bengaluru have begun working longer during night to avoid peak traffic hours amid rise in fuel costs, said reports. Cabbies are struggling to pay commission demanded by apps, the reports added. "Traffic in Bengaluru has taken a mental toll on them. There is no choice but to find alternative model," Karnataka Ola Uber drivers' association president said.

255.title: Was 'very scared' of women till 18, couldn't look them in the eye: Vijay
255.article_body: 'Arjun Reddy' actor Vijay Deverakonda said he was "extremely scared" of women till he turned 18. "I didn't have the balls to look a woman in the eye...I thought women were...a different species," added Vijay. Elaborating on his life while growing up, Vijay stated his father taught him that "love is bullshit" and he'll get love "if he has money".

256.title: Sonali wasn't the way she was portrayed in 'Bigg Boss': Vikas Gupta
256.article_body: Producer Vikas Gupta said he was "shocked" to learn about the death of BJP leader and actress Sonali Phogat. He said Sonali, who passed away on Monday, was nothing like how she was portrayed in 'Bigg Boss 14'. He said, in real life, she was positive, confident and health conscious. He called her an epitome of grace, warmth and kindness.

257.title: BJP, be careful: Manish Sisodia on claim of ₹20 cr offered to AAP MLAs
257.article_body: Soon after AAP MP Sanjay Singh claimed that BJP offered four party MLAs ₹20 crore each if they switched sides, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia tweeted, "BJP, be careful." He added, "These are Arvind Kejriwal's soldiers, followers of Bhagat Singh. They will sacrifice their lives but will never betray. CBI and ED are of no use in front of them."

258.title: Congress needs to come out of factionalism & stay united: Anand Sharma
258.article_body: Anand Sharma, who had resigned as the Chairman of Congress' Steering Committee for Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls, on Wednesday said Congress collectively has to revive. "Congress needs to come out of factionalism and stay united…What's important is that the Congress party stays strong," Sharma added. "I will campaign for Congress party wherever it is required," he stated.

259.title: Nigeria introduces Bharat Biotech's ROTAVAC to vaccinate children
259.article_body: Nigeria has introduced Bharat Biotech International Limited's (BBIL) rotavirus oral vaccine ROTAVAC to immunise its children against the diarrhoeal disease. About 50,000 children under the age of five years die every year in Nigeria due to rotavirus infection. Rotavirus accounts for about 2,15,000 out of 5,25,000-under-five mortality worldwide each year attributed to diarrhoeal diseases.

260.title: PM inaugurates Homi Bhabha Cancer Hospital and Research Centre in Punjab's Mohali
260.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday inaugurated the Homi Bhabha Cancer Hospital and Research Centre in Punjab's Mohali. Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann was also present at the event. The hospital, built at a cost of over ₹660 crore by Tata Memorial Centre, is a 300-bed facility. "Holistic healthcare...placed among the top priorities in India in the last eight years," PM said.

261.title: Stolen car found stuck in metro station in Spain; video surfaces
261.article_body: A video shows a stolen car stuck in a metro station in Spain's Madrid being removed by firefighters. Police said they are investigating after the vehicle was found next to a staircase in Plaza Eliptica station. Police officials further said that the driver was taken to hospital to be checked, adding that no one was injured.

262.title: Why can't Centre call all-party meet for discussion?: SC on freebies
262.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday, while hearing matter of promising freebies before elections, asked why can’t Centre call an all-party meeting to discuss the matter. "Why does not the Government of India form a committee to study this issue?" the bench led by CJI NV Ramana asked. Solicitor General Tushar Mehta replied that the Centre will help in every way.

263.title: Police shut down petrol pumps in Hyderabad Old City amid protests
263.article_body: The Hyderabad Police closed down petrol pumps across parts of the Old City as protests continue against the now suspended BJP MLA Raja Singh for his alleged controversial remarks against Prophet Muhammad. The Charminar is kept open for visitors for now, but will be closed in the case of any major protest or skirmishes, the Archaeological Survey of India said.

264.title: 2 killed, 3 injured in ambulance-motorcycle collision in Madhya Pradesh
264.article_body: At least two persons were killed and three others were injured when a motorcycle collided with an ambulance in Madhya Pradesh near the Thuna Pachama village on Bhopal-Indore Road, police said. The accident took place five kilometres from the district headquarters, City Superintendent of Police Niranjan Rajput added. Both the deceased were on the motorcycle and died on the spot.

265.title: Our sweetest megastar: 'Liger' actor Vijay Deverakonda on Chiranjeevi
265.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda took to Twitter and called actor Chiranjeevi the "sweetest megastar". "Chiru sirrrr...really hope you enjoy ['Liger'] and we make you proud," he added. This comes after Chiranjeevi took to Twitter and wished Vijay, director Puri Jagannadh and the 'Liger' team ahead of the film's release. Chiranjeevi also posted a picture alongside Vijay.

266.title: We won't be scared: Rabri Devi after CBI raids on RJD leaders
266.article_body: Former Bihar CM Rabri Devi criticised BJP over CBI raid at the residences of RJD leaders in connection with the 'land for jobs scam' and said that BJP is scared of the newly formed government in Bihar. "All parties are with us except BJP. We have the majority here in the state and we will not be scared," she added.

267.title: BMC to fine Ganesh mandals ₹2000 for each pit made while erecting pandals
267.article_body: If erecting Ganesh pandals cause any potholes on roads, the organisers of the mandals will be fined ₹2000 for each one of it, BMC said. The civic body has set up a team to check if the roads are damaged while setting up the pandals. The Ganesh mandals, however, said they've taken maximum measures to ensure no road is damaged.

268.title: I don't understand box office at all: Mona Singh on 'Laal Singh...'
268.article_body: Speaking about the box office collection of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', actress Mona Singh said, "I'm not a filmy person...don't understand box office at all." She further stated she is satisfied that people have good things to say about the film. "I don't want to think about the short-term things like how much money it made, that's beyond me," she added.

269.title: Never had knee injury as pacer: Akram on criticism over Shaheen's 'workload'
269.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram has reacted to PCB's criticism over Shaheen Afridi's injury, due to which the pacer has been ruled out of Asia Cup. "The think-tank has been criticised for not managing Shaheen's workload. But he's [22], he has to play cricket. He suffered a knee injury. I never had knee injury as a fast bowler," stated Akram.

270.title: Mumbai man who fell from Dahi Handi pyramid dies; organiser arrested
270.article_body: A 24-year-old man named Sandesh Dalvi succumbed to his injuries on Monday after falling from a Dahi Handi pyramid in Mumbai. The event's organiser, Riyaz Shaikh, was arrested on Tuesday on charges of causing death due to negligence. He was later granted bail. "The safety measures given by the government, which include providing helmets [and] safety nets...weren't followed," police said.

271.title: Patients getting 'fake calls' from us asking for money: Pune hospitals
271.article_body: Officials from Pune's Sassoon General Hospital (SGH) and other private hospitals have reported incidents wherein patients' families have allegedly received fake calls from 'hospital staffers' asking for money. The caller allegedly asked patients to send money to the bank account of a rickshaw driver, an official from SGH said. A complaint has also been filed on the behalf of SGH.

272.title: Video of 9-yr-old boy urinating in Mumbai society shared online; 2 booked
272.article_body: The secretary and a member of a housing society in Mumbai have been booked for allegedly sharing a video of a nine-year-old boy urinating on the staircase of the society building. The accused, booked under Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, had allegedly recovered CCTV footage of the child and had shared it on a WhatsApp group for residents.

273.title: 20-yr-old prisoner dies after fight with inmate inside Delhi's Tihar jail
273.article_body: A 20-year-old (Samir Khan) prisoner in Delhi's Tihar jail died after a fight with a fellow inmate in the barrack on Monday morning, officials said on Wednesday. "The whole incident is captured on CCTV cameras. Samir had no visible injuries. He was declared brought dead at the hospital," an officer said. Jail guards will be questioned for negligence, police said.

274.title: Sonali's death was a pre-planned murder, we doubt her personal assistant: Brother
274.article_body: Late BJP leader Sonali Phogat's brother Rinku on Wednesday said that her death was a "pre-planned murder". He said, "We've doubts on two people including her personal assistant. I demand a CBI investigation into her death." He added, "We are not satisfied with the postmortem done here in Goa. We want that it should be done again at AIIMS, Delhi."

275.title: ED recovers 2 AK-47 assault rifles from home of Jharkhand CM Soren's 'close aide'
275.article_body: The ED on Wednesday recovered two AK-47 assault rifles from the residence of middleman Prem Prakash in connection with an illegal mining and extortion case. Prakash is reportedly a close aide of Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren. The ED raided multiple locations in Ranchi today as part of its ongoing money laundering investigation into alleged illegal mining in the state.

276.title: Nothing compared to today: Mandakini on breastfeeding scene in 'Ram...'
276.article_body: 'Ram Teri Ganga Maili' actress Mandakini said her breastfeeding scene in the film is "nothing" in comparison to the skin show in today's times. "[The scene] was also...pure...Nowadays, it is all about sexuality," added Mandakini. "It was [actually] not a breastfeeding scene, it was shot in such a way that it could look like one," stated the actress.

277.title: Meta reaches $37.5 mn settlement in location tracking lawsuit
277.article_body: Meta reached a $37.5 million settlement in a lawsuit that accused the firm of violating users' privacy by tracking their movements without permission. Facebook allegedly violated its own privacy policy and a California law by accessing the data of users who had turned off location services. The settlement covers people in the US who used Facebook after January 30, 2015.

278.title: Children born in civic hospitals to soon be screened for deafness: BMC
278.article_body: BMC has decided to test every child born in Mumbai civic hospitals for deafness and will soon appoint an agency for the screenings. "BMC will start (screening) in its 47 hospitals and maternity homes including KEM, Nair and Sion hospitals and Wadia...a private hospital," an official said. "Within six months, the child will get a hearing aid," another official added.

279.title: Australian church asks staff to not use Uber over ethical concerns
279.article_body: The Uniting Church in Australia's Victoria and Tasmania Synod ordered its staff to not use Uber and Uber Eats citing concerns over the treatment of drivers and delivery riders. It said that many Uber staff earned below the minimum wage and worked excessive hours as they were independent contractors. Uber said it was "committed to improving standards for independent contractors".

280.title: Ranbir apologises over comment on Alia's pregnancy weight gain; video surfaces
280.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor has apologised for his comment on wife Alia Bhatt's pregnancy weight gain. "Well, I can see somebody has phailoed (spread out)," he had said. "It's a joke that didn't turn out to be funny. It wasn't my intention. I spoke to Alia...and she laughed it off...I apologise to those who got offended by it," he said.

281.title: 29-yr-old Indian-American hiker, who was swept away in a flash flood, found dead
281.article_body: A 29-year-old Indian-American female hiker, who got swept away in a flash flood last week at the Zion National Park in US' Utah, has been found dead. A rescue operation was launched after Jetal Agnihotri went missing on August 19. Her body was found on Tuesday in the Virgin River after a thorough rescue operation by the rangers, officials said.

282.title: Maguire warned there's no guarantee over his Man United place: Reports
282.article_body: Manchester United captain Harry Maguire, who was dropped for the Liverpool match, has reportedly been warned by manager Erik Ten Hag that his place in the lineup is not guaranteed every week. According to reports, Ten Hag has suggested there will be rotation among the centre-backs. Earlier, Ten Hag had confirmed Maguire will remain United's captain for the season.

283.title: Want to challenge myself against Pant, he'd probably hit me for a six: Lee
283.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee said he'd like to "challenge" himself against Rishabh Pant. "I had the pleasure of playing against Sachin Tendulkar...Pant would be very exciting to bowl to," added Lee. "He'd probably hit me for a six," he stated. Discussing Pant's unorthodox strokes, Lee had said he would have been "blowing up" if similar shots were played against him.

284.title: I don't think he's there yet: Styris on Shubman's place in India's T20I squad
284.article_body: Ex-New Zealand cricketer Scott Styris has said Shubman Gill is not "there yet" to be included in India's T20I squad. "I think he will be [in the team], let's say 12 months from now. He's making his way nicely from the Test side through to the T20s," added Styris. Shubman scored his maiden ODI hundred in the recently-concluded Zimbabwe ODIs.

285.title: Leopard sighted again at Pune's DRDO facility, rescue operation on
285.article_body: The operation to rescue a leopard continued at a research and development facility of the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) in Pune after the animal was sighted again late on Tuesday night. The leopard's movement was captured by a thermal camera in an area near a water tank. However, the immediate rescue of the animal could not be done.

286.title: 2 threaten to blow up Mumbai's Lalit Hotel, held from Gujarat
286.article_body: Mumbai Police on Wednesday arrested two people from Gujarat for threatening to blow up Mumbai's Lalit Hotel. The duo called the hotel and said that bombs were placed at four places in the building and asked for ₹5 crore to defuse them, a police official said. Earlier, a police official had said that it appeared to be a hoax call.

287.title: Nancy Pelosi's husband sentenced to  5-day jail term for drunken driving
287.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's husband, Paul Pelosi, has been sentenced to five days in jail as he pleaded guilty to causing injury by drunken driving in California on May 28. A judge gave him four days' credit for good behaviour and the time he already served in jail. He has been ordered to perform eight hours of community service.

288.title: 'Godman' rapes woman, wife makes video in Karnataka; both booked
288.article_body: Karnataka Police booked a "godman" and his wife for allegedly sexually exploiting a woman for years. The main accused allegedly drugged and raped her, and his wife made a video of the act, police said. The "godman" met the victim at an event five years ago and told her something bad is going to happen to her and her family.

289.title: Japan plans to work on next-generation nuclear power plant: Reports
289.article_body: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida has planned to call for development of a new-generation nuclear power plant, according to reports. The plan, likely to be announced during a Green Transformation meeting, comes at a time when fuel prices are rising. Japan kept most of its nuclear reactors non-operational since a tsunami triggered a disaster in Fukushima in 2011.

290.title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine was 'reborn' when Russia invaded
290.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy delivered a speech during which he said that Ukraine had been "reborn" when Russia invaded in February. The recorded speech marked 31 years of independence and six-month anniversary of the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Zelenskyy, 44-year-old wartime leader, said that Ukraine opposes any kind of compromise that would allow Moscow to lock in territorial gains.

291.title: FCI takes short-term loan of ₹22,000 crore to finance ops: Report
291.article_body: The Food Corporation of India (FCI) has reportedly availed of a short-term loan of ₹22,000 crore in the current financial year. FCI has taken the loan because the Finance Ministry has allocated around ₹52,000 crore under the food subsidy budget until now against expenses of over ₹75,000 crore. FCI avails of loans for 90 days to address cash flow mismatches.

292.title: Video captures moment 40-metre superyacht sinks off coast of Italy
292.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that captured the moment when a 40-metre superyacht completely sank into the Mediterranean Sea. The vessel sank off the coast of southern Italy and was heading from Gallipoli to Milazzo. While the reason the yacht sank is being investigated, the coast guard was able to rescue nine people from the ship.

293.title: China's battery firm CATL doubles profits in Q2 on high EV sales
293.article_body: Chinese battery maker, CATL, has more than doubled its profit in the second quarter as China announced incentives to boost sale of electric vehicles. According to Reuters, CATL made a net profit of $974.61 million from April to June, registering a 164% increase from a year ago. The company said that COVID-19 outbreak in various cities impacted its domestic market.

294.title: Singapore to ease indoor mask, 7-day quarantine requirements
294.article_body: Singapore's Health Ministry has said that it will ease requirements to wear masks indoors as the country's COVID-19 situation further stabilises. People will no longer be required to wear a face mask indoors, except on public transport and high-risk areas like medical facilities. Authorities have also decided to drop a seven-day quarantine rule for non-vaccinated travellers from next week.

295.title: Sisodia has no escape route, there's evidence he indulged in corruption: Patra
295.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) spokesperson Sambit Patra on Wednesday said that Delhi Deputy Chief Minister and AAP leader Manish Sisodia does not have an escape route. "There is evidence that he indulged in corruption," Patra added. "AAP is trying to deflect BJP's questions on malpractices in implementation of Delhi's liquor policy," Patra stated.

296.title: Pune man claims wife used black magic to control him, approaches court
296.article_body: A Pune court has taken cognisance of allegations made by a man against his wife and in-laws, claiming that they had carried out black magic to gain "control over him". The man in his complaint stated that he had found lemon, green chilies and charcoal in his cupboard. The court has ordered a probe under relevant sections of the CrPC.

297.title: Why has Thailand Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-ocha been suspended?
297.article_body: Thailand PM Prayuth Chan-ocha was suspended from official duties by the country's Constitutional Court on Wednesday. The suspension came after the court decided to hear a petition seeking review of his legally mandated eight-year term limit. The petition, filed by the main opposition party, said Prayuth's time spent as head of a military junta should count towards his term.

298.title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal flags off 97 electric buses today
298.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal inaugurated 97 more electric buses at Rajghat Depot-I today, taking the total number of electric buses in Delhi Transport Corporation's (DTC) fleet to 249. Each one of the buses is estimated to cut 0.33 million tonnes of PM 2.5 and PM 10 carbon dioxide (CO2) each in its life span of 10 years, officials said.

299.title: Delhi AIIMS mess shut over unhygienic conditions reopened in an hour: Doctors
299.article_body: The hostel mess of Delhi AIIMS, shut by FSSAI over several irregularities and unhygienic conditions, was reopened within an hour, Resident Doctors Association (RDA) alleged. The administration didn't take any steps to address the issues, it claimed. RDA, in a letter to AIIMS Director Dr Randeep Guleria, stated pests were found in food during a surprise inspection on August 10.

300.title: AAP MLAs being given threat of CBI and ED: Arvind Kejriwal
300.article_body: Addressing an inauguration event, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "In the last 2-3 days, some AAP MLAs have told me that they are being given the threat of CBI and ED." "They are being lured with money to leave AAP, this is a very serious issue. We have called a meeting of our political affairs at 4 pm," he added.

301.title: B'luru software engineers booked for raising pro-Pak slogans on Clubhouse
301.article_body: Two software engineers from Bengaluru have been booked for allegedly raising pro-Pakistan slogans on audio chat app Clubhouse on August 15 and August 16. The two had reportedly urged members who were part of the discussion to change their display picture to the Pakistan flag. However, police haven't made any arrests yet, stating those involved had no connection with Pakistan.

302.title: Farmer who sent workers home on a plane during lockdown found hanging in Delhi temple
302.article_body: A 55-year-old farmer who sent his workers home to Bihar on a plane during the 2020 COVID-19 lockdown was found hanging in a temple in Delhi on Wednesday. Pappan Singh Gehlot was found hanging at the temple in front of his house in the Alipore area of Delhi. Police officials also recovered a note.

303.title: This is lobbying: Vivek on Dylan Mohan calling 'Kashmir...' 'garbage'
303.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has reacted to Canadian filmmaker Dylan Mohan Gray's comments on his film 'The Kashmir Files'. "This is all lobbying and politics. My political acumen is better than most filmmakers...Tell me, how did someone sitting in Canada notice my film? That means somebody is lobbying," Vivek said. Dylan had called Vivek's film 'hate-mongering garbage'.

304.title: We're taking it seriously, DGP is monitoring: Goa CM on Sonali Phogat's death
304.article_body: Following BJP leader Sonali Phogat’s death in Goa, CM Pramod Sawant said, "We're taking it seriously." He added, "DGP himself is monitoring. Investigation and post-mortem reports will come to him. Preliminary, as per doctors and DGP, it seems to be cardiac arrest," Sawant added. Phogat's sister Raman has said their family isn't ready to accept she died of heart attack.

305.title: Shooting of Kamal Haasan's 'Indian 2' resumes after a 2-year gap
305.article_body: Filmmaker Shankar took to Twitter and announced that they have resumed the shoot of Kamal Haasan-starrer 'Indian 2' after two years. "We are glad to announce that the remaining shoot for 'Indian 2' is commencing today! Need all of your support and wishes," Shankar tweeted. The shoot halted in February 2020 after an accident on set killed three people.

306.title: Spent under ₹10 cr annually on promotions: Dolo 650 manufacturer amid freebies claim
306.article_body: Micro Labs, the manufacturer of Dolo 650, said that it spent under ₹10 crore annually on brand marketing and promotion. It added that the only freebies it gave out included books, pens and small mementoes. The company’s clarification comes at a time when it is being accused of offering freebies worth ₹1,000 crore to doctors to promote Dolo 650.

307.title: Finland's PM Sanna Marin apologises for pic of 2 topless women kissing at her residence
307.article_body: Finland's PM Sanna Marin has apologised for a photo taken at her official residence which showed two women kissing, lifting their tops to bare their torsos and covering their breasts with a sign reading 'Finland'. This comes after a video surfaced showing Marin partying with a group of friends and celebrities, after which she had to take a drug test.

308.title: KKR were 7 down, needed 80 runs; McCullum said 'Just 13 more sixes': Venkatesh
308.article_body: Recalling an anecdote from an IPL match where KKR had lost seven wickets with 80 runs required, KKR all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer said the franchise's former coach Brendon McCullum met the players and said, "Just 13 more sixes needed." "That...makes you feel that you will be able to achieve it," added Venkatesh. "McCullum doesn't let the pressure affect anyone," he stated.

309.title: Nobody can put pressure on 'Mahagathbandhan' govt: JD(U) MLC on CBI raids
309.article_body: JD(U) MLC Neeraj Kumar said the central government has used CBI and ED as government instruments after the CBI raided the residences of two RJD leaders. "Bihar is the land of democracy and [it] does not matter if you send a dozen agencies, there is no one to create pressure on 'Mahagathbandhan' government," Kumar added.

310.title: Even when I was coach we discussed we were a bit timid at the top: Shastri
310.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said India should continue with their "aggressive" approach in T20Is. "It's the right approach...If you start winning with this approach, you can take that confidence in big games," he added. "Even when I was coach, we discussed we were a bit timid at the top considering the players we had down the order," added Shastri.

311.title: Shaheen Bagh protest not independent movement, backed by PFI: Delhi Police to HC
311.article_body: The protests at Shaheen Bagh for Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) were not organic or an independent movement, Delhi Police told the Delhi High Court. Popular Front of India (PFI) and Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) were behind the protests and locals did not support it at various places, the police said, adding that people were transferred to these sites.

312.title: BJP offered 4 AAP MLAs ₹20 cr each to switch sides: MP Sanjay Singh
312.article_body: BJP offered four AAP MLAs ₹20 crore each if they switched sides and ₹25 crore if they bring other party leaders with them, Delhi Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh claimed. "In Maharashtra, MLAs are protesting 'Khokha-Khokha 50 Khokha'," he added. "Like BJP formed government in Maharashtra, MP, Arunachal, Karnataka...Manipur, similar efforts are being made in Delhi," AAP's Durgesh Pathak said.

313.title: His craze increased due to The Kapil Sharma Show: Late singer KK's son
313.article_body: Late singer KK's son Nakul said his father's popularity had increased after his appearance on 'The Kapil Sharma Show'. "After ['The Kapil Sharma Show'], the craze went even higher," he said. Daughter Taamara added, "Dad didn't do TV much, but after that, people were so happy to see him." KK had featured in the show with Shaan and Palash Sen.

314.title: Tata Sons may have to write-off AirAsia India's losses: Report
314.article_body: Tata Sons might have to make a ₹2,600 crore provision as accumulated losses for AirAsia India as Tata-owned Air India seeks to fully acquire the latter's equity share capital, according to a report. Tata Sons has 83.67% stake in AirAsia India. Whether the write-off will be included in Tata Sons or Air India's balance sheet is yet to be decided.

315.title: PM Narendra Modi inaugurates Asia's largest private hospital in Faridabad
315.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday inaugurated Amrita Hospital in Faridabad's Sector-88. The 2,600-bed hospital, managed by Mata Amritanandamayi Math, is claimed to be Asia's largest private hospital. "The hospital, which is being constructed at an estimated cost of around ₹6,000 crore, will provide state-of-the-art healthcare facilities to the people of Faridabad and the entire NCR region," PM said.

316.title: Felt awkward buying pregnancy kit, everyone knew I just had baby: Debina
316.article_body: Actress Debina Bonnerjee, who recently announced her second pregnancy, has revealed that she felt awkward while buying a pregnancy kit. "The whole world knows I just had a baby...I..ordered it online," she added. Debina further said that she was shocked, extremely happy and did not know what to do next after she got to know she was pregnant.

317.title: Deepak Chahar should be 'first-choice' pacer for India in Asia Cup: L Balaji
317.article_body: Ex-India pacer L Balaji has said pacer Deepak Chahar, who has been named among the back-ups for the Asia Cup, should be a "first-choice" bowler in the tournament. "In the UAE...the new ball skills are needed...If Bumrah and Shami are not available, Chahar is the one who provides that," stated Balaji. Chahar registered figures of 3/27 and 2/75 against Zimbabwe.

318.title: Police carries out flag march as protests erupt over Prophet remarks in Hyd
318.article_body: The Telangana Police on Wednesday carried out a flag march in Hyderabad after protests erupted against suspended BJP leader T Raja Singh. Meanwhile, all petrol pumps across parts of Hyderabad Old City were closed amid the protests. This comes after Raja Singh was granted bail hours after his arrest on Tuesday over his alleged remarks against Islam and Prophet Muhammad.

319.title: BEST will operate additional buses during Ganeshotsav, double-deckers for Lalbaug
319.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) will launch buses from 11 pm to 6 am to help devotees have 'darshans' of various idols during Ganeshotsav. The authorities have launched over 3,300 MSRTC bus routes to meet the demands starting at month-end. BEST is also planning to run double-deckers from 10 pm to 6 am for several areas including Lalbaug.

320.title: Release of Bilkis' convicts shows our failure, I will request PM to undo it: BJP leader
320.article_body: Senior BJP leader Shanta Kumar has criticised the Gujarat government for releasing the 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case. He said, "I'll request the Prime Minister to use his influence to undo this remission...it shows our failed commitment to protecting women." He also said, "I bow my head in shame", adding that the convicts should be hanged.

321.title: Hearing this from media: Gehlot on reports of being offered Cong chief post
321.article_body: Amid reports that Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has been offered the Congress President post by the party's President Sonia Gandhi, Gehlot said, "I'm hearing this from the media." He added, "I don't know about this. I am fulfilling duties that have been assigned to me." Earlier, Gehlot had said that Rahul Gandhi should accept Congress President’s post.

322.title: Sundaram Mutual launches Sundaram Flexi Cap Fund, NFO closes Aug 30
322.article_body: Sundaram Mutual launched an open-ended equity scheme, Sundaram Flexi Cap NFO closing on August 30. "Flexi Cap Funds can outperform over market cycles. They allow for greater diversification & investors can stay invested in the best cap curves, sectors, stocks across all market scenarios, relaxing while the fund manager optimizes opportunities for them," said Sunil Subramaniam, MD, Sundaram Mutual.

323.title: Waited for 8 hrs due to discussion on Shahid's shoes: Kiara on Kabir Singh
323.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani said she b**ch-slapped Shahid Kapoor, who was her co-star in 'Kabir Singh', "in her head" as she had to "wait for eight hours" due to a discussion on Shahid's shoes for a scene. Kiara revealed this during an episode of 'Koffee with Karan 7', where Shahid was present. Host Karan Johar said he'd have done the same.

324.title: Twitter merges misinformation & spam teams amid whistleblower’s claims
324.article_body: Twitter is combining its health experience and the Twitter service teams to reduce toxic content and spam bots amid claims by whistleblower Peiter "Mudge" Zatko. The 'health' team works on reducing misinformation and harmful content, while the service team reviews reported profiles and takes down spam accounts. The new group will be called 'Health Products and Services'.

325.title: HPCL starts work on first cow dung-based compressed biogas project
325.article_body: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL) on Tuesday started its first cow dung-to-compressed biogas project in Rajasthan's Sanchore. Under the GOBAR-Dhan scheme, the plant will utilise 100 tonnes of cow dung per day to produce biogas, which will then be used as automotive fuel. The plant is slated to be commissioned in a year. The groundbreaking ceremony took place in Pathmeda.

326.title: Clickbait journalism: Meesho CEO on report claiming company planning a down round
326.article_body: Addressing a media report alleging Meesho evaluating a down round at a valuation at least 25% down from its last funding round, CEO Vidit Aatrey called it a "false" story. Aatrey wrote, "Sad to see this clickbait journalism. Fabricating stories about townhalls that never happened to "source driven" fake anecdotes of a down round...Be more responsible about what you write".

327.title: Kerala govt moves HC against sessions court judge's 'sexually provocative dress' remark
327.article_body: Kerala government moved the High Court against Kozhikode Sessions Court judge's "sexually provocative dress" remark and sought to set aside the order granting anticipatory bail to author Civic Chandran in a sexual harassment case. The government submitted a plea stating that the findings of the court are "illegal, unjust and have the effect of potentially exposing survivor to secondary trauma".

328.title: 1,000 Ganesh Mandals get approval via Pune Police's single window system
328.article_body: About 1,000 of 1,200 applications pertaining to pandals and loudspeakers for Ganesh Mandals have been approved so far via Pune Police's single window system at police stations. Through the single window programme, launched for Ganeshotsav Mandals, police verify applications and authorisation is granted swiftly. "We have given permission to many Mandals within an hour," DCP Priyanka Narnaware said.

329.title: Came to Mumbai to become SRK, realised there can't be another SRK: Sohum
329.article_body: Actor Sohum Shah has said that he came to Mumbai to become another Shah Rukh Khan, however, he added, "I realised there cannot be another Shah Rukh Khan in the industry." Sohum further stated that his choice of projects so far was not a deliberate decision. "I have learnt to go with the flow in the past decade," he added.

330.title: Athiya, KL Rahul's wedding will happen as soon as they decide: Suniel
330.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty, speaking about daughter Athiya Shetty and cricketer KL Rahul's wedding plans, has said, "It will happen as soon as the kids decide." He added that Rahul has a busy schedule due to upcoming tours. "The wedding will happen only when the kids get a break," he stated. "The wedding will be planned when there's time," he added.

331.title: Real test for him starts now: Karim on Gill's performances vs Zimbabwe, WI
331.article_body: With Shubman Gill scoring 205 runs in three WI ODIs and 245 in as many Zimbabwe ODIs, Saba Karim has said the "real test" for the 22-year-old will start now. "[Bowlers] will devise plans to get him out," he added. "This is the new breed of Indian cricketers who've been impressive...Shubman is right up in the pecking order," stated Karim.

332.title: Oppn parties should keep aside differences, unite against BJP: Pawar
332.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that Opposition parties should keep aside their differences and unite to take on the BJP in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. He said he would make efforts to unite non-BJP political parties. "We political leaders may not be that intelligent...common man is intelligent. The common man will teach BJP a lesson in 2024," Pawar added.

333.title: No delay in variable payout process, 100% being paid in Q1: TCS
333.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) on Tuesday denied media reports that claimed the company had delayed the variable pay for senior employees for the June quarter. "We have come across completely incorrect reports...Variable pay is either paid in month one or month two...and there is no delay in this process. 100% variable pay is being paid for Q1," TCS said.

334.title: AAP ignored recommendations of expert panel on excise policy: BJP
334.article_body: The BJP on Tuesday alleged that the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP)-led Delhi government had ignored recommendations of an expert committee formed to reform liquor trade in the capital. For example, the expert committee was against promotions to push liquor sales, said BJP MP Parvesh Verma. However, the Delhi government gave a carton free on every carton sold, he added.

335.title: Centre issues advisory to states on Tomato Flu
335.article_body: Centre has issued an advisory to states on Hand, Foot and Mouth Disease or Tomato Flu. It is a self-limiting illness mostly targeting young children aged 1-10 years and immunocompromised adults with no specific drug to treat it. The virus is not related to SARS-CoV-2, monkeypox, dengue or chikungunya. Best prevention is maintenance of proper hygiene and sanitisation of surroundings.

336.title: Had rejected 1200-1300 proposals: Actress Kanishka who married herself
336.article_body: TV actress Kanishka Soni, who claims that she's married to herself, said she rejected "1200-1300" proposals. "A very famous actor proposed to me for marriage, but his real face was uncovered in...two months...He was very violent," added Kanishka. "For an A-grade film in 2008, the producer asked me to visit his house so he could see my stomach," she stated.

337.title: I'll try to get fully fit for T20 World Cup: Buttler on calf injury in The Hundred
337.article_body: England limited-overs captain Jos Buttler, who has been ruled out of the remaining games in The Hundred with a calf injury, has said he'll try to get "fully fit" for the T20 World Cup in Australia later this year. "It's frustrating...I've really been enjoying playing," he added. Currently, Buttler is the sixth-highest run-getter in the tournament with 203 runs.

338.title: BJP stooped even lower: RJD on CBI raids on its leaders
338.article_body: The Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) criticised BJP after the CBI raided the residences of two RJD leaders just ahead of the floor test in the Bihar Assembly. "Our Deputy CM had said in the meeting yesterday that they will reach this level now. It didn't take even 24 hours. They stooped down even lower," RJD MP Manoj Kumar Jha said.

339.title: Vijay Kumar Sinha resigns as Speaker of the Bihar Assembly
339.article_body: Vijay Kumar Sinha has resigned as the Speaker of the Bihar Assembly. This comes ahead of the floor test in the state Assembly. Notably, Sinha on Tuesday refused to resign from his position. "RJD legislators had not served me the no-confidence motion on August 9 in a proper format. They did so on August 10," he said.

340.title: Noida twin tower demolition will see over 1,000 truck loads of debris: Official
340.article_body: After the demolition of Noida's illegal Supertech twin towers on Sunday, around 1,200 to 1,300 truck-loads of debris would have to be moved out from the site, an Edifice Engineering partner Utkarsh Mehta said. According to the estimates prepared by project officials, the demolition of the towers would leave behind approximately 35,000 cubic metres of debris to be cleared.

341.title: Video shows woman beating Zomato delivery agent with shoe, company responds
341.article_body: A video of a woman beating a Zomato delivery agent with her shoe has surfaced on social media. A Twitter user who shared the video, wrote that the woman took his order from the delivery agent and the latter was left "terrified that he would lose his job". Meanwhile, Zomato replied to the video and wrote, "We're getting this checked."

342.title: I usually hit '100-150' sixes daily during practice: Pak batter Asif Ali
342.article_body: Pakistan batter Asif Ali said he "usually hits 100 to 150 sixes daily" during practice sessions, so that he can hit four to five sixes during the match. "I bat at a position where an average of over 10 is required. For that, you need to hit big shots and that requires a lot of practice," added Asif.

343.title: Dubbing was essential in 90s, South actresses couldn't speak proper Hindi: Anu
343.article_body: Actress Anu Aggarwal refuted rumours that her voice was dubbed in the 1990 film 'Aashiqui'. "I haven't heard of this one. Fake rumour," she said. Speaking about South actresses being dubbed in the 1990s, she stated, "At that time, many actresses from the South couldn't speak proper Hindi. So, dubbing was essential." 'Aashiqui' was directed by Mahesh Bhatt.

344.title: 'Soon will realise the sofa I'm sitting on is bought,' Mahua shares text on Adani-NDTV move
344.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra has shared a text message she received as Adani Group acquired 29.18% stake in television channel NDTV, which read, "Soon I will be watching Netflix and then I will realise they've bought the sofa I'm sitting on." Notably, NDTV said that 29% of the media company was acquired without any discussion, consent or notice.

345.title: He had you doing a 360: Ferdinand on Ronaldo snubbing Carragher
345.article_body: Talking about Cristiano Ronaldo ignoring an attempted handshake by ex-Liverpool defender Jamie Carragher, before Manchester United's win against Liverpool, ex-Manchester United footballer Rio Ferdinand jokingly tweeted, "[He] had Carragher doing a 360 like the old days." "Bad night from start to finish...Blanked by...Ronaldo...& Liverpool all over the place!" read Carragher's reaction on Twitter.

346.title: I said no need to pay heed to those who spread misconception: Teni on 'dog' remark
346.article_body: Following his "dogs bark on road or chase car" remark, Union Minister Ajay Misra Teni said, "I just said there's no need to pay heed to such people who spread misconception." He added, "When workers asked me about Rakesh Tikait's viral video where he maybe mentions people of Lakhimpur Kheri to be goons, I simply said...it's below my level."

347.title: Oil prices fall amid receding fears of OPEC+ cutting production
347.article_body: Oil prices declined on Wednesday amid receding fears of OPEC+ cutting production to stabilise the market after a recent drop in oil futures. Brent crude futures fell 21 cents to $100.01 a barrel, while the US West Texas Intermediate crude futures contract dropped 10 cents to $93.64 a barrel. The prices had risen 3.9% and 3.7%, respectively, on Tuesday.

348.title: Forced to file FIR: MP health official after 3 journalists booked over a story
348.article_body: A medical officer in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind, Rajeev Kaurav, on whose complaint three journalists were booked, purportedly said that he was "forced to file the FIR". "How can I file the complaint when I don't even know their names?" Kaurav added. The journalists were booked over a story on a family taking a man to a hospital on a cart.
