349.title: Casemiro receives text from Real Madrid star's girlfriend after Man Utd move, pic viral
349.article_body: After midfielder Casemiro joined Manchester United, his former Real Madrid teammate Federico Valverde's girlfriend Mina Bonino sent him a WhatsApp message asking him to not leave Real Madrid. Mina shared a screenshot of the text on Twitter, which went viral. "Don't leave, you s**t b*****d," the translation of the text read. Casemiro won five Champions League titles with Real Madrid.

350.title: 4 hurt in protests against suspended BJP MLA over Prophet remarks in Hyd
350.article_body: Four people, including a police sub-inspector, were injured during protests against suspended BJP MLA Raja Singh in Hyderabad on Tuesday night. Protests followed by instances of violence broke out after Singh got bail following his arrest by the Hyderabad police. This comes after Raja Singh released a video wherein he passed derogatory comments about Prophet Muhammad.

351.title: We missed Hardik Pandya badly in last year's T20 WC: Ravi Shastri
351.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said all-rounder Hardik Pandya is "one of the most important cogs in the wheel" for the team. "You take Hardik out of the squad and the balance goes away...We missed him really badly in the 2021 (T20) WC," added Shastri. "There's no one close to Hardik when it comes to quality," he further said.

352.title: Eradicate 'orderly' system in police completely in 4 months: Madras HC
352.article_body: Madras High Court (HC) on Tuesday directed the Tamil Nadu government, the Director-General of Police and the Greater Chennai Police Commissioner to completely eradicate the "orderly" system in police in four months. "Though these police personnel are working as menials in the residence of the higher police officials, they are to be construed as 'oppressed and depressed' class," HC stated.

353.title: Meghan reveals she had to continue royal tour after son's room caught fire in 2019
353.article_body: Meghan Markle has revealed how she and Prince Harry left their son Archie and proceeded for an "official engagement" shortly after the baby's room caught fire in 2019. She said that while they were on South Africa tour as part of their royal duties, a fire broke out in his nursery minutes before he was taken out of there.

354.title: No split in MVA, united to take on Shinde-Fadnavis govt: Ex-Maha CM
354.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, while chairing a meeting with Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) partners Shiv Sena, NCP, Congress and other smaller parties on Tuesday, announced that there was no split amongst them. He added that the MVA partners will together take on Shinde-Fadnavis government on key issues in the next assembly elections. "We'll fight but...not back down," he added.

355.title: Europe is facing its worst drought in 500 years: Report
355.article_body: A report by the European Commission's science and knowledge service, the Joint Research Centre, shows that nearly two-thirds of Europe is threatened by drought. The drought may be the worst in "at least 500 years", Johannes Bahrke, European Commission spokesperson, said. The report mentioned that 47% of Europe is under warning conditions with a soil moisture deficit.

356.title: Ex-police officer pleads guilty for role in Breonna Taylor shooting
356.article_body: A former police officer in Louisiana, Kelly Goodlett, has pleaded guilty in federal court for helping falsify a search warrant that led to shooting of a black woman, Breonna Taylor in 2020. Goodlett pleaded guilty to one count of conspiracy. The former police officer could face a five-year prison term, a $250,000 fine and three years of supervised release.

357.title: Markets open flat with Sensex down 16 points, Nifty at 17,579.7
357.article_body: The benchmark indices opened flat on Wednesday amid weak global cues with the Sensex falling 16.32 points to 59,014.98. The Nifty rose by 2.20 points to 17,579.70. ONGC, IndusInd Bank, Apollo Hospitals and Sun Pharma were among the major Nifty gainers. Stocks of Bharti Airtel, Eicher Motors, Asian Paints and Grasim Industries slipped. Nearly 1,419 shares advanced and 501 declined.

358.title: India reports 10,649 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, 24% higher than yesterday
358.article_body: India has reported 10,649 new COVID-19 cases and 36 deaths in the last 24 hours including four reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Health Ministry. Active cases in the country stood at 96,442, while the daily positivity rate increased slightly to 2.62%. India also reported 10,677 recoveries in the last 24 hours, taking the total recoveries to 4,37,44,301.

359.title: Meat seized at cold storage in Mumbai found to be beef, case filed
359.article_body: The Mumbai Police booked the manager and owner of a cold storage company after frozen beef worth ₹1.5 crore was found in their storage. Police took action after the company failed to provide documents in support of the commodity seized at their premises. The samples were later sent for forensic tests and report revealed that the frozen meats were beef.

360.title: Shehzada will do remarkably well, don't have fear of boycotting: Ankur
360.article_body: Actor Ankur Rathee, who will next feature in Kartik Aaryan-starrer 'Shehzada', has said that the film will do "remarkably well". "This is an action-packed comedy that people will find themselves laughing at and enjoying themselves," he said. Ankur further added, "I don't have any fear in terms of boycotting or something like that." The film will also feature Kriti Sanon.

361.title: You're wrong, I'm coming: Vijay on SRK calling himself the 'last' superstar
361.article_body: Reacting to Shah Rukh Khan calling himself the "last" superstar, actor Vijay Deverakonda said, "I...wanted to say, 'SRK, you're wrong. You're not the last. I'm coming.'" Deverakonda earlier said he wants to steal SRK's title of "King". Deverakonda further shared he feels "insulted" if somebody terms his performance as "good", adding that it has to be "extraordinary".

362.title: I'll kill myself if athletes complain: UP official whose objectionable pics went viral
362.article_body: After UP Olympic Association's Secretary General Anandeshwar Panday's pictures in compromising position with different women went viral and a report was sought by Regional Sports Officer Lucknow, Panday said, "Somebody is out to defame me." He added, "If an...athlete...ever complains against me, hang me. I'll kill myself. I've been in sports since...1970s, there has never been any such incident."

363.title: Media persons against Bihar CM as they are not getting liquor: JD(U) chief
363.article_body: JD(U) chief Rajiv Ranjan (Lalan) Singh on Tuesday said several media persons are against Bihar CM Nitish Kumar as "they are not getting liquor". "Liquor ban was done on the demands of women in Bihar," Singh said. "What can we do? Would the CM think of his people or worry about journalists not being able to enjoy themselves?" he asked.

364.title: Ex-Punjab minister Bharat Bhushan Ashu sent to police custody till Aug 27
364.article_body: Former Punjab Food and Civil Supplies Minister Bharat Bhushan Ashu has been sent to police custody till August 27 in connection with the alleged food grains transportation tenders scam. Ashu was arrested from Ludhiana by Punjab Vigilance Bureau on Monday. Commenting on allegations of "political vendetta", CM Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday said that "law is taking its own course."

365.title: Dorsey had 'drastic loss of focus' in last year as Twitter CEO: Whistleblower
365.article_body: Whistleblower Peiter Zatko alleged that Jack Dorsey suffered a "drastic loss of focus" in his final year as Twitter CEO. In his complaint, Zatko claimed that Dorsey was "extremely disengaged" during the last months of his tenure as CEO and wouldn't even speak during meetings on complex issues facing the company. Dorsey stepped down as Twitter CEO in 2021.

366.title: Rahul Gandhi can't be forced to take over as Cong President: Digvijaya
366.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh said Rahul Gandhi cannot be forced to take over as Congress President. Meanwhile, another Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said no one outside the Gandhi family can lead the party now. The Indian Express quoted Chowdhury as saying, "Either Rahul Ji or Sonia Ji. We don’t have any other alternative. Whatever people may say...that's the reality."

367.title: CBI raids 2 RJD leaders in Bihar in land for railways jobs case ahead of floor test
367.article_body: CBI on Wednesday morning raided two Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leaders in Bihar in an alleged land for railways jobs case. CBI raided RJD MLC Sunil Singh's residence in Patna reportedly in connection with the case. "It is being done intentionally. There is no meaning to it," Singh said. Notably, this comes ahead of the Bihar Assembly floor test today.

368.title: Sonali said something fishy is going on, she cut the call & didn't pick up: Sister
368.article_body: Late BJP leader Sonali Phogat's sister Rupesh said she received a call from her before her death, where she said she wanted to talk on WhatsApp, adding that something fishy was going on. "Later, she cut the call and didn't pick up," Rupesh said. Sonali's sister Raman said their family is not ready to accept she died of heart attack.

369.title: It's going to take a special delivery to get Babar out in Asia Cup: Styris
369.article_body: Ex-New Zealand cricketer Scott Styris has said it's going to take a "special delivery" to dismiss Pakistan captain Babar Azam in the upcoming Asia Cup. "What [bowlers] look to do is to give Babar a single and get him off strike and bowl [to] the [other] guy," added Styris. Currently, Babar is the top-ranked batter in both ODIs and T20Is.

370.title: Hospitals being run like companies where profit making is more important: CJI
370.article_body: Private hospitals are being opened at an exponential rate which is not necessarily a bad thing, but there is a "glaring need for balance", CJI NV Ramana said. "We're seeing hospitals being run like companies, where profit making is more important than service to society," he added. "Due to this, hospitals...doctors alike are desensitised towards patients' plight," he stated.

371.title: Delhi Police's new Commissioner to restart 'Jan Sunwai' after 2 years
371.article_body: Delhi Police Commissioner Sanjay Arora will begin 'Jan Sunwai' (public hearing) in his office at police headquarters from today. This will be the first 'Jan Sunwai' session by a Delhi Police chief in the past two years as the practice was stopped due to COVID-19. 'Jan Sunwai' will be held from Monday to Friday from 10 am to 12 noon.

372.title: Sonali told mother she can sense problem as if someone was doing something to her: Sister
372.article_body: Late Sonali Phogat's sister Raman said their mother spoke to her on Monday and Sonali told her, "Mummy, I'm feeling slightly upset in the stomach. I can sense some problem soon after eating my food as if somebody was doing something to me." Sonali said that she was feeling as if some conspiracy was being played on her, Raman added.

373.title: I support Man Utd but Liverpool were better: Schweinsteiger on Utd's win
373.article_body: Discussing Manchester United's 2-1 win against Liverpool, World Cup-winning German footballer Bastian Schweinsteiger said he supports United, but admitted that Liverpool were the better team with much more possession. "They couldn't finish their last passes otherwise they would've won," added Schweinsteiger. "Was this the way United want to play football?...That was survival mode," he stated.

374.title: B'luru Metro's Electronic City corridor to be ready by June 2023: BMRCL
374.article_body: Bengaluru Metro's Electronic City corridor will begin operations in June 2023, according to representatives from Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL). The entire Yellow Line will begin operations in two phases. While the Bommasandra to Central Silk Board section will start functioning in June, the section from Central Silk Board to RV Road will be opened by December 2023.

375.title: I choose films that make little more sense with genuine story: Nithya Menen
375.article_body: Actress Nithya Menen has said that commercial cinema does not excite her. "When it comes to commercial cinema, you pick and choose what you want and package it in a way so that you can sell it to the audience," she stated. Nithya added that she chooses films that "make a little more sense" and have a genuine story.

376.title: Transform your career with MTech Data Science & Engineering: BITS Pilani
376.article_body: According to a Markets and Markets report, Data Science Platform Market size is set to expand at CAGR of 27.7% to reach USD 322.9 billion by 2026. BITS Pilani WILP encourages learners to get ahead of their peers by pursuing its MTech Data Science and Engineering and build their careers as Data Analysts, Data Architects, Data Engineers and Data Scientists.

377.title: 7 history-sheeters held in connection with Pune petrol pump robbery bid
377.article_body: Pune City Police arrested seven history-sheeters in connection with a petrol pump robbery bid. This comes after police received a tip-off of an attempt to rob a petrol pump in Mangalwar Peth. Police seized 20 mobile phones worth ₹1.07 lakh from their possession. Notably, around eight criminal cases for robbery are registered in Delhi and Secunderabad against the prime accused.

378.title: Musk's ex-girlfriend auctions their pics, gifts to raise money for son's college fee
378.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s ex-girlfriend, Jennifer Gwynne, is auctioning off photographs and personal items from their one-year relationship to raise money for her stepson's college tuition. Gwynne reportedly dated Musk in 1994, when they were in their 20s and were studying at the University of Pennsylvania. The items to be auctioned included their pictures, Musk's handwritten note and a necklace.

379.title: Hyd Police auctions off 1,142 abandoned vehicles for over ₹64 lakh
379.article_body: Hyderabad City Police on Tuesday organised an auction of 1,150 abandoned and unclaimed vehicles and collected ₹64,63,200. Out of the total vehicles, 1060 abandoned vehicles in scrap condition were auctioned for ₹53 lakh, whereas 82 two-wheelers in roadworthy condition were auctioned for over ₹11 lakh, police said. About 550 bidders from Andhra Pradesh and Telangana were present at the event.

380.title: Mumbai Metro Line 7 & 2A 98% ready, trial runs to commence by Oct: MMRDA
380.article_body: The under-construction Metro Line 7 from the Western Express Highway and Line 2A from Link Road are both 98 percent complete and Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) is planning to begin the trial runs by October this year. MMRDA also aims to start the remaining stretch of commercial operations by December this year.

381.title: Sonia Gandhi to travel abroad for medical check-up; Rahul, Priyanka to accompany her
381.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi will be travelling abroad on Wednesday for medical check-ups, the party said late on Tuesday night. Sonia will be accompanied by her children Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra. She will also visit her ailing mother before returning to New Delhi, AICC general secretary in-charge of communication Jairam Ramesh said.

382.title: Execs allowed Twitter to become dependent on money from Chinese entities: Whistleblower
382.article_body: Whistleblower Peiter Zatko, in his disclosure to Congress and federal agencies, alleged that Twitter executives allowed the microblogging platform to become more dependent upon revenue coming from Chinese entities. This was despite the fact that Twitter is blocked in China, he added. Twitter executives knew that accepting Chinese money risked endangering users in China, the disclosure read.

383.title: Who is Peiter 'Mudge' Zatko, the Twitter whistleblower?
383.article_body: Peiter 'Mudge' Zatko, who filed a whistleblower disclosure with the US Securities and Exchange Commission against Twitter, was Twitter's security chief from November 2020 to January 2022. He is a famous hacker and one of US' top cybersecurity experts. Before Twitter, Zatko oversaw security at the electronic payments company Stripe. He also worked on special projects at Google.

384.title: Brother-sister duo, associate held for murder in Delhi's Jamia Nagar
384.article_body: A Nasir gang sharpshooter, identified as Sultan Azim, his sister and their associate were arrested for allegedly killing a 30-year-old man to usurp his flat in Delhi's Jamia Nagar, police said. Azim executed the murder following his release from jail three to four months ago, police added. Azim was involved in a Delhi policeman's murder in Karkardooma Court in 2015.

385.title: Thane family runs out of their house after leopard enters in
385.article_body: A leopard entered a family's house in Umbarkhand village in Maharashtra's Thane on Tuesday after which the family ran out of the residence and locked the leopard inside it. Later, the leopard was rescued by the forest officials. The female leopard, believed to be two-three years old, entered the residence's kitchen area when Lahu Nimse's family was asleep, officials said.

386.title: Twitter CEO suggested the company become complicit with the Putin regime: Whistleblower
386.article_body: Twitter's current CEO Parag Agrawal suggested that the microblogging platform become complicit with Russian President Vladimir Putin's regime, whistleblower Peiter Zatko stated. "It is a cause for concern about Twitter's effects on US national security," he added. Zatko further stated that Agrawal's suggestions were discarded.

387.title: Told Yuvraj that hundred isn't coming, he asked me not to worry: Gill
387.article_body: India opener Shubman Gill revealed he met former cricketer Yuvraj Singh ahead of the Zimbabwe tour and it was his advice that worked for the batter. "He advised me to bat deep...I was telling him that hundred is not coming. He told me not to worry," said Gill. Gill scored 130 runs in the third ODI, his maiden international ton.

388.title: Barcelona looking to sign Cavani, Januzaj and Belotti: Report
388.article_body: Barcelona are reportedly looking to further strengthen their attack and are looking to sign Edinson Cavani, Adnan Januzaj and Andrea Belotti. The La Liga giants, despite being cash-strapped, have spent €163.2 million so far this summer. Reports further say the move might come on the last day of the window after Barcelona know of the players that are exiting.

389.title: Amitabh Bachchan tests positive for COVID-19 for the second time
389.article_body: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan has tested positive for COVID-19 for the second time. He tweeted, "I have just tested COVID-19 positive...All those [who] have been in my vicinity and around me, please get yourself checked and tested also." He earlier tested positive for COVID-19 in July 2020 following which he was hospitalised for 22 days.

390.title: All political parties in favour of freebies: Supreme Court
390.article_body: All political parties including the BJP are in favour of freebies, the Supreme Court said while discussing a PIL opposing the promise of these handouts during elections. The court said that a judicial attempt was made to deal with this. The bench said that it was not against any government policy or scheme and was trying to balance equity.

391.title: Sri Lankan Navy arrests 10 Indian fishermen for poaching
391.article_body: The Sri Lankan Navy has arrested 10 Indian fishermen for allegedly poaching in the country's territorial waters, an official statement read on Tuesday. The fishermen were apprehended on Monday off the northeast coast of Sri Lanka and their trawlers were seized. A Navy attack craft chased the Indian fishermen before the arrests were made, the statement said.

392.title: Unicorn India Ventures to sell stakes in 6 startups to US-based fund
392.article_body: Early-stage investment firm Unicorn India Ventures has decided to sell its stakes in six startups in its portfolio to US-based Continuum Fund for ₹50 crore, doubling returns for Limited Partners (LPs). The startups include Genrobotics, Sequretek, Clootrack, Inc42, Inntot and NeuroEquilibrium. These investments are from the company's first round of funding of ₹100 crore deployed across 17 startups.

393.title: Wasn't allowed to hold him till two and a half months: Dia on son Avyaan
393.article_body: Dia Mirza said her son Avyaan Azad underwent two surgeries right after his birth. "I wasn't even allowed to hold him till two and a half months had passed after he was born," she said. She said that phase of her life was "tough" but she believed that Avyaan would not leave her and "would fight and survive".

394.title: ITBP jawan, his wife killed after truck hits car in Rajasthan
394.article_body: An ITBP head constable and his wife were killed after their car was hit by a truck in the Sadar area of Rajasthan's Sikar district. The couple, Ashok Badhadhara (24) and Ankita (22), were going to Laxmangarh when they met with the accident while overtaking the truck, police said. Notably, the couple have left behind their four-year-old daughter.

395.title: Passage on fertility to be deleted from new Polish school textbook
395.article_body: A school textbook in Poland containing a controversial passage purportedly criticising in vitro fertilisation is being edited, its publisher said. Publishing house Bialy Kruk defended the book but said the passage will be deleted for "social good". The passage reads, "Increasingly sophisticated methods...lead to the treatment of sex as entertainment...who will love the children thus produced?"

396.title: B2B fintech Indium Finance raises ₹4.5 cr from India Angel Network
396.article_body: Mumbai-based Non-Banking Financial Company (NBFC) Indium Finance has raised ₹4.5 crore from India Angel Network (IAN). IAN lead investors Sanjay Rishi, Raman Roy, and Manipal Group led the round. Founded by Shalabh Mohan and Vivek Kumar in 2019, the company plans to use the capital for acquiring new customers, building the product platform and expanding its sales and technology teams.

397.title: Govt announces rent-free accommodation for 6 months for retired CJIs
397.article_body: The central government on Tuesday notified changes to the Supreme Court Judges Rules, 1959. Chief Justices of India will now get rent-free Type-VIl accommodation in Delhi for six months after demitting office. Further, apex court judges will get round-the-clock security and will also be entitled to a chauffer and a secretarial assistant for one year upon superannuation.

398.title: Shows courage, bravery: Root on Stokes opening up about mental health struggles
398.article_body: England batter Joe Root lauded Ben Stokes for openly speaking about his mental health struggles, saying it shows "great courage and bravery". He added, "We were all there with him going through it. It's not easy to see a close friend and teammate like that, but look at him now." Stokes took an indefinite break from cricket last summer.

399.title: Goa joins 'Save Soil' campaign, signs MoU with Isha Outreach
399.article_body: Joining the 'Save Soil' campaign, the Goa government on Tuesday signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with Sadhguru's Isha Outreach. Union Minister of State for Tourism Shripad Naik was also present at the event. "Goa's economy is dependent on soil, whether it is agriculture, mining or tourism. It's our duty to conserve...ecology and environment," Goa CM Pramod Sawant said.

400.title: Same-sex marriage plea hearings shouldn't be telecast: Govt
400.article_body: The Central government has opposed the live streaming of hearing on petitions in the Delhi High Court related to the recognition and registration of same-sex marriages. Stating that there is a possibility of the live stream being edited or morphed, the government said the sanctity of the proceedings could be lost. The petitions have been listed for hearing on Wednesday.

401.title: BSF hands over 2 rescued Bangladeshi fishermen to BGB
401.article_body: The Border Security Force handed over two rescued Bangladeshi fishermen to Border Guard Bangladesh on Tuesday. The fishermen duo, Md Hanif Maula and Md Salim Holder, were rescued by Indian fishermen after their boats capsized due to inclement weather in the Haribhanga river. They were handed over to BGB as a gesture of goodwill and humanity, BSF said.

402.title: Former Pak PM Imran Khan gets court summon in contempt case
402.article_body: A Pakistani court on Tuesday summoned former Prime Minister Imran Khan to appear before it next week in connection with contempt charges against him. Khan is alleged to have verbally threatened a judge during a rally over the weekend. If convicted, Khan will be barred from running for public office for life, as per Pakistani law.
